title: Advanced Maui Optical and Space Surveillance Technologies Conference AMOS 2025
description:
Welcome to AMOS 2025!

The [AMOS 2025](https://amostech.com/) Conference is set to take place from September 16-19, 2025, at the stunning Wailea Beach Resort in Maui, Hawaiʻi. As the premier technical conference dedicated to space situational awareness (SSA) and space domain awareness (SDA), AMOS 2025 promises to be an essential gathering for professionals across government, academia, and the private sector.

Overview of the AMOS 2025 Conference

The Advanced Maui Optical and Space Surveillance Technologies (AMOS) Conference has established itself as a leading platform for discussing critical issues in space safety and sustainability. With a rich history spanning over two decades, AMOS has continually adapted to the evolving landscape of space exploration and technology. The conference fosters collaboration among diverse stakeholders, facilitating discussions that are vital for the future of space operations.

Importance of Space Situational Awareness

As more nations and private entities engage in space activities, the need for robust SSA/SDA has never been more pressing. The AMOS conference serves as a vital forum for addressing these challenges. Attendees can expect to engage in discussions about the latest advancements in technology, policy frameworks, and international cooperation efforts aimed at ensuring a safe and sustainable space environment. This year’s event will emphasize the importance of shared knowledge and collaborative strategies in tackling emerging threats in space.

Networking Opportunities

One of the standout features of AMOS 2025 is its focus on networking. The conference provides numerous opportunities for participants to connect with industry leaders, technical experts, and policymakers. By fostering these connections, AMOS aims to promote innovative partnerships that can lead to groundbreaking advancements in SSA/SDA technologies. Attendees will have the chance to participate in technical presentations, panel discussions, and keynotes from prominent figures in the field.

Key Themes and Discussions

The agenda for AMOS 2025 will cover a wide range of topics relevant to current trends in SSA/SDA. Participants can look forward to sessions addressing:

* **Technological Innovations**: Exploring cutting-edge technologies that enhance space surveillance capabilities.
* **International Collaboration**: Discussing frameworks for cooperation among nations to ensure collective security in space.
* **Policy Development**: Engaging with policymakers on regulations that govern space activities and protect assets in orbit.

Celebrating a Milestone

AMOS 2025 marks a significant milestone as it builds upon the successes of previous conferences. The event reflects the growing interest in space sustainability and commerce initiatives, highlighting the critical role that diverse stakeholders play in shaping the future of space exploration. With an anticipated increase in attendance from various countries, this year’s conference is expected to be one of the largest yet.

Conclusion

In conclusion, attending AMOS 2025 offers a unique opportunity for professionals involved in SSA/SDA to gain insights into the latest developments while connecting with like-minded individuals committed to advancing space safety. As we approach this landmark event, it is clear that AMOS continues to be an indispensable part of the global conversation on space situational awareness. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this transformative experience at Wailea Beach Resort in Maui!

title: Space Innovation Forum 2025
description:
The Space Innovation Forum 2025 returns to Kiruna for two dynamic days focused on innovation, sustainability, and the future of space. Hosted by Space Sweden North, this high-energy event brings together policymakers, entrepreneurs, engineers, researchers, and students to explore real-world space tech, emerging challenges, and collaborative solutions. From student-driven innovation pitches and workshops to discussions on sustainability in the supply chain, 6G satellite comms, and open innovation, the forum offers a mix of keynotes, panels, interactive sessions, and networking. Confirmed speakers include top leaders from SSC, OHB Sweden, LTU, Aalto University, Vinnova, Swedish Armed Forces, and the Swedish Space Agency. Whether you’re part of a space agency or startup, academia or local government, this is your platform to connect, collaborate, and shape the next frontier.

Day 1 focuses on vision, networking, and high-level discussions in a central venue.  
📍 Venue Day 1: Aurora Kultur och Kongress, Stadshustorget 10, Kiruna

Day 2 shifts to a more technical, immersive environment at Space Campus to dive into workshops and applied innovation.  
📍 Venue Day 2: Space Campus, Bengt Hultqvists Väg 1, Kiruna

title: The Space Logistics Conference
description:
Welcome to The Space Logistics Conference 2025

The Space Logistics Industry is on track to generate $21 Billion by 2040, 20% of the total revenue of the space economy.

SAE Media Group has closely followed the progress of the field for three decades and it’s clear the community is standing on the precipice of a new era. The Space Logistics Conference is the only event which will bring together the vital stakeholders who are charting the future of the orbital ecosystem in one place, with a distinct focus on government policy, regulation and partnership opportunities that you will not find elsewhere.

This is your chance to connect with these leaders, learn about successes as well as challenges and shape the way ahead.

Orbital technology is going to radically alter the space environment. Satellites are going to be refuelled and repaired, or have their orbits shifted and access to space will be more reliable and affordable. A wide-ranging logistics architecture is going to be established to enable exploration from the Moon to Mars, as well as deeper into the solar system. Closer to Earth, a robust cargo transfer network is going to be vital for manufacturing cutting edge technology in orbit. These topics are the foundation of The Space Logistics Conference.

How will The Space Logistics Conference Look?

25+ **plenary presentations** from leading experts in the field will give you exclusive knowledge and inspiration. Sharing insights on vital topics such as movement of cargo, last-mile delivery, payload hosting, propulsion, sustainability, servicing and how best to work with government partners.

Dedicated **networking time** where you can connect, share experiences, discuss common issues, and work together towards industry goals with top-tier experts, all gathered in one place at one time.

A bustling **exhibition space** with stands from key companies in the field, ready to share and explore the latest tech and innovations.  
A chance to hear the holistic view of NASA technology and policy through a wide-ranging list of subject matter experts and senior leaders.  
150+ representatives from all the key institutions in the field of Space Logistics.

Don’t miss out – this is your exclusive opportunity to stay at the forefront of Space Logistics. Be part of the first instalment of this groundbreaking event. Make history with your community and enhance your programs to remain a step ahead!

Cultivate indispensable connections that may serve as the driving force behind your next significant breakthrough!

Should you wish to join the increasing number of companies benefiting contact Justin Predescu, Sponsorship Manager on +44 (0) 20 7827 6130 or justin.predescu@saemediagroup.com

title: AFA National Convention 2025
description:
AFA National Convention 2025

The Air & Space Forces Association is governed by our National Convention body under the structure of the AFA Bylaws.

For the 2024 AFA National Convention, AFA welcomed 152 official delegates from across the country and abroad. Delegates participated in four Chapter-focused workshops and a two-day business session which included keynotes from AFA leaders and special guests, including Civil Air Patrol’s National Commander, Maj. Gen. Regena Aye.

The AFA National Convention 2025 will be held at National Harbor, MD, on 20 and 21 September 2025. More info will follow.

title: European Microwave Week EuMW 2025
description:
Welcome to the 28th European Microwave Week

The 28th edition of the European Microwave Week (EuMW 2025) will come to Utrecht to continue the annual series of highly successful microwave events that started back in 1998. EuMW 2025 comprises three co-located conferences:

Three Conferences, Three Forums, One Week, One Location: Learn more about each conference and forum below. For those interested in hosting a Workshop, Short Course, Focussed or Special Session, you can find the proposal templates on this page as well.

### The European Microwave Conference (EuMC)

**23 – 25 September 2025**

Join us at the 2025 European Microwave Conference in Utrecht, The Netherlands, from September 23-25, 2025. This premier event, part of European Microwave Week, is dedicated to microwave, millimetre-wave, and terahertz technologies. Engage with peers and experts, explore cutting-edge topics like 6G, IoT, and sustainable RF technologies, and discover the latest advancements in high-frequency devices and systems. With over 50 sessions, this conference offers exceptional networking opportunities and insights into both academic and industrial applications. Don’t miss this chance to be at the forefront of microwave innovation!

### The European Microwave Integrated Circuits Conference (EuMIC)

**22 – 23 September 2025**

Join us at the 20th European Microwave Integrated Circuits Conference (EuMIC) in Utrecht, The Netherlands, from September 22-23, 2025. This premier event, part of European Microwave Week, is dedicated to RF, microwave, millimetre-wave, and terahertz electronics. Engage with experts, explore cutting-edge topics, and discover the latest advancements in integrated circuit technology. With a focus on innovation and networking, this conference offers exceptional opportunities to connect with the community and stay at the forefront of technological trends. Don’t miss this chance to be part of the future of integrated circuits!

### The European Radar Conference (EuRAD)

**24 – 26 September 2025**

Join us at the 22nd European Radar Conference (EuRAD 2025) from September 24-26, 2025, in Utrecht, The Netherlands, as part of European Microwave Week 2025. This premier event will showcase cutting-edge radar research, technologies, and applications. Connect with global experts and explore topics like Radar Principles and Modelling, Radar Technologies, Radar Signal Processing, Algorithms and AI, and Radar Applications. Don’t miss this opportunity to be at the forefront of radar innovation and network with leading researchers and practitioners. Submit your papers and be part of shaping the future of radar!

The European Microwave Exhibition

**23 – 25 September 2025**

Europe’s Premier RF, Microwave, Radar and Wireless Event is the largest trade show dedicated to Microwaves and RF in Europe, providing:

* 8,000 sqm of gross exhibition space
* Around 4,000 key visitors from around the globe
* 1,500 – 1,700 conference delegates
* In excess of 300 international exhibitors (including Asia and US as well as Europe)

The exhibition will offer its exhibitors an unrivaled opportunity to present products, technological developments and form relationships with relevant and interested spectators including academics, professionals and industry figureheads. It also offers a forum for discussing trends and exchanging scientific and technical information.

title: III Congresso Aeroespacial Brasileiro
description:
Introdução ao III Congresso Aeroespacial Brasileiro 2025

O **III Congresso Aeroespacial Brasileiro (III CAB)**, programado para ocorrer em 2025, representa um marco significativo na promoção da colaboração entre as instituições que atuam nos setores aeronáutico e espacial no Brasil. Este evento bienal é uma plataforma essencial para pesquisadores, acadêmicos, e profissionais do setor discutirem inovações, desafios e oportunidades no campo aeroespacial. Com o objetivo de fortalecer a sinergia entre universidades, centros de pesquisa e indústria, o congresso promove um ambiente propício para a troca de conhecimentos e experiências.

Temas Cruciais

Durante o III CAB, serão abordados temas cruciais como **tecnologia espacial**, **defesa**, e **sustentabilidade**. O evento contará com palestras de especialistas renomados, painéis de discussão e sessões técnicas que visam aprofundar a compreensão sobre as tendências atuais e futuras do setor. Além disso, o congresso incentivará a apresentação de trabalhos acadêmicos, permitindo que novos talentos tenham a oportunidade de compartilhar suas pesquisas com uma audiência qualificada.

Avanço da Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento

A realização do III CAB é fundamental para o avanço da pesquisa e desenvolvimento no Brasil, especialmente em um momento em que o país busca se destacar no cenário global da tecnologia espacial. Com a participação de representantes do governo, da academia e da indústria, o congresso promete ser um catalisador para iniciativas inovadoras que poderão transformar o setor aeroespacial brasileiro.

Welcome to the 3rd Brazilian Aerospace Congress 2025

A Vital Platform

The **III Brazilian Aerospace Congress (III CAB)** is set to take place in 2025 and aims to enhance collaboration among institutions in the aerospace and aeronautics sectors in Brazil. This biennial event serves as a vital platform for researchers, academics, and industry professionals to discuss innovations and challenges within the aerospace field.

Key Topics

Key topics at the congress will include **space technology**, **defense**, and **sustainability**. The event will feature renowned experts delivering lectures, panel discussions, and technical sessions to deepen understanding of current and future trends in the sector. Additionally, it encourages the presentation of academic papers, providing emerging talents with the chance to share their research with a qualified audience.

Importance for Brazil

The III CAB is crucial for advancing research and development in Brazil as the country seeks to establish itself on the global stage of space technology. With participation from government representatives, academia, and industry leaders, the congress is expected to catalyze innovative initiatives that could transform the Brazilian aerospace sector.

title: Aerospace Additive Manufacturing Summit
description:

title: The AstroEdu Conference 2025
description:
AstroEdu 2025

The AstroEdu Conference series which launched in 2019 showed that there is a need for a conference dedicated to bringing together researchers and practitioners from the astronomy, astronomy education, general education and other communities.

This third conference celebrates two decades since the publication of “Teaching and Learning Astronomy: Effective Strategies for Educators Worldwide” and in doing so looks at the rich diverse perspectives in astronomy education from across the world. This event brings together two major astronomy education conferences AstroEduCon and RTSRE to reflect on the past 10 years, and look ahead a decade.

AstroEdu Series

Astronomy education has grown significantly in recent decades. More academic and practitioner groups are publishing research articles. However, there is no regular international conference for researchers and practitioners to share their work. This meeting aims to be the first in a series of biennial IAU Commission C1 Astronomy Education Conferences. Its goal is to improve the quality, quantity, community, and impact of astronomy education.

The conference will unite astronomers, education researchers, and practitioners. They will discuss challenges, share ideas, and explore common issues. Topics will include theoretical research and practical applications. Participants will focus on applying research findings in real-world settings, guided by standards, curriculum, and instruction. The event will also review astronomy education outcomes from the IAU Strategic Plan 2010–2020. Additionally, it will address strategies for meeting the next plan’s goals.

Conference Themes

* Theory and Methodology – Highlighting the developments and innovations in research methodologies and theoretical perspectives.
* Research and Practice – Highlighting the innovations in bringing astronomy into the classroom and beyond.
* Looking ahead – Learning from the past, building the present, and looking forward to the future

title: Aeromart Nagoya
description:
What is Aeromart Nagoya?

Aeromart Nagoya is a flagship aerospace B2B event in Japan. It covers a wide array of topics related to the latest technologies and trends for supply chain continuity and manufacturing competitiveness.

It is a unique B2B matchmaking platform that gather buyers (OEMs & Tier-1 suppliers) and different types of suppliers from the entire manufacturing supply chain and give you the opportunity to make new connections and strengthen your existing ones.

Event Highlights

title: 21st European Space Mechanisms and Tribology Symposium ESMATS 2025
description:
Welcome to ESMATS 2025!

ESMATS’s reputation as lead event dedicated to Space Mechanisms Engineering continues to grow. The 2023 edition in Warsaw saw a gathering of over 300 guests, speakers, and exhibitors. We hope to see even more visitors in 2025.

Established as a biennial event since 1983, ESMATS returns to Switzerland after 20 years. This time participants will convene to western Switzerland, renowned for its cultural heritage in the art of mechanisms now evolved to prestigious watchmaking and pioneering technology.

As a tradition, prior to the conference, specialized training courses will offer attendees the opportunity to enhance expertise in targeted areas of mechanism and tribology.

EPFL, Almatech, CSEM, and ESA extend a warm invitation to participate in the 21st edition of ESMATS, set to take place in Lausanne, Switzerland. We eagerly anticipate your presence at this esteemed event and the accompanying courses – welcoming you to Lausanne in September 2025!

ESMATS 2025 Objectives

EMSMATS 2025 will attract space scientists, mechanism designers and engineers from all over the world. The aims of the symposium are:

* To foster a dialogue between space mechanisms engineers on the design, development, testing, production and in-flight experience of spacecraft and payload mechanisms to encourage personal contacts in the mechanisms and tribology community
* To provide a networking opportunity as well as a presentation platform for companies and organisations
* To encourage the transfer of technology to and from space applications
* To promote awareness that space opportunities afford sustainable industrial growth

EPFL and the SwissTech Convention Center

Pivoting around education, research and innovation, Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL) provides an ideal setting to foster dialogue among established industry leaders, start-ups, and future engineers.

Belonging to the EPFL Campus, the SwissTech Convention Center (STCC) is one of the largest convention centers in the Lake Geneva region, hosting internationally renowned events. This majestic architecture is distinguished by its modernity, its innovative technologies and its warm and experienced team.

title: Space Generation Congress SGC 2025
description:
On behalf of the Space Generation Congress SGC 2025 Organising Team, we are pleased to welcome you in Sydney to join us for the 23rd SGC. The annual SGC brings together delegates and colleagues from government, industry, academia, policy-makers, and entrepreneurs to debate and discuss issues affecting our fast-growing sector.

### **How can I participate at SGC 2025?**

The Space Generation Congress is only open to students and young professionals aged 18-35, who have successfully applied through SGAC and/or been given a scholarship seat by one of our partners. Applications for SGC 2025 will open soon. **Keep an eye on the SGAC news page and social media for updates and how to apply!**

### **How do the working groups (WG) at SGC work? What would we need to do?**

If you have registered to attend SGC 2025, **information about working groups topics and how to selcet your preferred choices will be released soon. You will find more information on the SGC 2025 website, as well a detailed email will be sent to registered SGC delegates.**

*Before the event*

You will be introduced to the sponsors through email and the moderator of each specific working group will share some reading material which will help you understand what the topic is all about.

*During the event:*

You will be introduced to the sponsors, they will go through the topic with you in detail and explain what their motivation is to put the topic as a working group topic and what they expect from you. Each sponsor will have different expectations in terms of what objectives they want to achieve, and they will be there to support you throughout the three days. Your role, essentially, will be to brainstorm ideas and to talk to other delegates in your group to share ideas and discuss how you can tackle the specific problem that has been proposed to you.

In the third day, you will mostly work on a presentation. This will be presented to the entire SGC community towards the end of the third day. It will then be filed into a report reader, which template will be given to you during the working group activity.

title: 32nd IAF Workshop – Resilient Coasts, Resilient Earth
description:
Held in conjunction with IAC 2025, the 32nd IAF Workshop brings together government officials, marine and space experts, civil protection authorities, NGOs, academia, and industry leaders to address one of Earth’s most urgent challenges: building coastal resilience through space-based solutions.

🔹 Workshop Theme: Resilient Coasts, Resilient Earth: Innovative Space Solutions for Coastal Resilience and Emergency Management

🔹 Key Topics & Objectives:  
✅ Highlight the synergies between space for oceans and disaster-risk reduction  
✅ Promote the use of EO, digital twins, GeoAI, IoT, and cloud platforms for coastal and emergency applications  
✅ Showcase pilot projects and case studies supporting SDG 13 (Climate Action) and SDG 14 (Life Below Water)  
✅ Facilitate new partnerships—especially for Small Island Developing States (SIDS) and Least Developed Countries (LDCs)  
✅ Raise awareness of the UN-SPIDER program and other capacity-building efforts

title: International Astronautical Congress IAC 2025
description:
The 76th International Astronautical Congress (IAC) is coming to Sydney, Australia and the countdown has begun!

This prestigious event is where the world’s space community gathers to access the latest advancements and trends, academic works, industry connections, and partnership opportunities.

IAC 2025 in Sydney, Australia is hosted by Space Industry Association of Australia (SIAA) and co-hosted by Australian Space Agency and NSW Government.

This will be the third time Australia has hosted the IAC, with previous events held in Melbourne in 1998 and Adelaide in 2017. The 76th IAC in Sydney in 2025 presents a generational opportunity to showcase the rapid progress of Australia’s space industry and the importance of space-enabled services to the Australian way of life. The event will highlight Australia’s commitment to learning from indigenous knowledges and collaborating with First Nations communities on the deployment and use of space technologies.

The event will broaden the influence and relevance of space to adjacent industries, including emergency services, health, utilities, telecommunications, resources, manufacturing, finance, construction, agriculture, and Smart Cities. It will delve into why space is critical for both businesses and our everyday lives.

IAC 2025 aims to advance space in the Indo-Pacific by showcasing the entire region and its wide variety of space-based opportunities.

About the IAF

The IAF is the world’s leading space advocacy body and actively encourages the development of space activities for peaceful purposes. It is also organizer of the annual International Astronautical Congress (IAC), the world’s premier global space event.

About the Space Industry Association of Australia (SIAA)

The Space Industry Association of Australia is the national peak body for the space industry in Australia. SIAA and its member companies work closely with Australian governments, international partners, academia, and industry to advance Australia’s space industry and economy. SIAA hosted the 68th International Astronautical Congress in Adelaide, Australia in 2017, and is proud to host the 76th International Astronautical Congress in Sydney, Australia in 2025.

title: RADECS 2025
description:
The 2025 edition of the RADiation Effects on Components and Systems (RADECS) Conference will be held on September 29 – October 3 at A Room with a ZOO in Antwerp (Belgium). It is organized by KU Leuven on behalf of the RADECS Association and is technically co-sponsored by the IEEE-NPSS.

The **RADiation Effects on Components and Systems (RADECS) Conference** is an annual European (and, more generally, international) scientific and industrial forum on radiation and its effect on electronics and photonics materials, devices and systems. Every year it attracts hundreds of scientists and engineers from all over the world, focusing on the latest advances and results about open topics and challenges related to radiation effects.

The 2025 edition will be held on 29 September to 3 October 2025 at ‘A Room with a Zoo’, in the historic city centre of Antwerp, Belgium. Cutting-edge research on the effects of the space, terrestrial and artificial radiation environments on electronic devices will be presented by world-leading experts in a friendly atmosphere, together with the most recent radiation data, collected on components of high interest for the space community.

Audience

More than 500 attendees are expected among researchers and engineers working on radiation effects on electronics for space and high-reliability terrestrial applications.

RADECS 2025 Topics

Topics at this event include:

* Basic Mechanisms of Radiation Effects
* Radiation Effects in Devices and Integrated Circuits:
  + Total Ionizing Dose (TID),
  + Total Non-Ionizing Dose (TNID),
  + Synergistic Effects,
  + Single Event Effects (SEE)
* Radiation Environments
* Radiation Test Facilities & Dosimetry
* Radiation Hardening Techniques (Device, board and system level)
* Radiation Hardness Assurance
* Radiation Effects in Photonics, Optoelectronics and Sensors
* Radiation Effects in complex devices and systems

Exhibition

By exhibiting at RADECS 2025, companies will benefit from extensive exposure to our international, focused attendance interested in industry innovations.

The industrial Exhibition will be located at the Conference Venue in the main atrium hall, where coffee breaks and the Exhibition Reception will take place, to guarantee the maximum visibility for all exhibitors.

Posters and the Data Workshop will also be displayed near the Exhibits. All attendees have to go through the Exhibition area to go to the auditorium and to see posters and data workshop, maximizing the traffic flow to all areas of the exhibition.

title: Space-Ship 2025
description:
One Giant Leap Australia presents Space-Ship! A fun and educational themed cruise.

Space-Ship Cruise 2025

Departing Sydney after the Congress on 5th October, this 4 day cruise will take guests on a fun and educational journey offering the opportunity to learn, network and relax aboard the family friendly, Carnival Splendor. Space-Ship will travel to one of Australia’s most beautiful locations, the pristine beaches of Moreton Island in Queensland before returning to Sydney 9th October.

[![Space-Ship Cruise Itinerary](https://www.spaceagenda.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Space-Ship-Cruise-Itinerary.jpg)](https://spaceshipcruises.com.au/)

Space-Ship Cruise 2025 Itinerary

### About One Giant Leap Australia

One Giant Leap Australia provides life opportunities for students and educators to develop and build their knowledge and understanding of Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics. The development of a fully equipped future workforce requires a diverse and dynamic set of skills that will meet the needs of employers within Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) industries. One Giant Leap Australia builds and maintains student interest in STEM while monitoring the changing industry requirements and providing innovative programs to meet those needs. We include parents, educators, community, industry and all levels of government working toward achieving a strong STEM sector.

Since 2008, One Giant Leap Australia has forged strong working relationships and partnerships with a range of educational institutions and providers; local, state and national government agencies; STEM-based companies; aeronautical and astronautical researchers and scientists and other community-based organisations.

One Giant Leap Australia also develops bespoke programs to suit the needs of industry. As well as facilitating global collaborations between schools and other educational institutions as well as internships and work experience opportunities for young people. With a long history in the STEM sector and an extensive global network, One Giant Leap Australia is inspiring and educating the STEM space pipeline from preschool onwards.

title: 9th Asia-Pacific Conference on Synthetic Aperture Radar APSAR 2025
description:
Welcome to the 9th Asia-Pacific Conference on Synthetic Aperture Radar (APSAR 2025)

“SAR Technology and Applications for Sustainability”  
5-9 October 2025, Matsue, Shimane, Japan

The Asia-Pacific Conference on Synthetic Aperture Radar (APSAR) is an international conference devoted to SAR technology development and applications and Co-Sponsored by Institute of Electronics, Information and Communication Engineers (IEICE), Japan and IEEE Geosciences and Remote Sensing Society (GRSS).

The APSAR is a forum of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) engineers and scientists from all over the world, especially from the Asia-Pacific region. The bi-annual APSAR conference is held every two years in China, Japan, Korea, Australia, and Singapore in turn, and The 9th Asia-Pacific Conference on Synthetic Aperture Radar was planned to be held in Matsue, Shimane, Japan.

Concept of APSAR 2025

Sponsors and Exhibitors are cordially invited to join us for APSAR 2025. This conference will be a great opportunity to promote your company/research institute as well as to meet researchers and industrial staffs in the field. APSAR has been one of the major SAR Symposiums, standing shoulder to shoulder with IEEE GRSS and AESS since 2008. In APSAR 2025, about 200 papers are expected to be  
presented by SAR experts from all over the world, with about 300 participants expected at the exhibition.

There is growing concern about changes in the global environment, such as the frequent occurrence of abnormal weather events in various regions. The main causes of these changes are the various effects of our social activities. In particular, the SDGs and various other movements are taking place in the international community to review the activities of human society that are directly linked to  
environmental changes, such as excessive emissions of CO2 and other greenhouse gases that cause global warming, the loss of vast forests due to development, and ocean pollution that is becoming increasingly serious. There is a wide range of capabilities required to minimize global environmental changes and realize a sustainable society. Join the conference to discuss SAR.

APSAR 2025 overview

The 9th APSAR(APSAR2025) will be held in Person on 5-9 October 2025 in Kunibiki Messe (Shimane Prefectural Convention Center), Shimane Prefecture, Japan. About 200 papers will be presented in oral sessions or in interactive poster sessions. Almost 300 participants are expected. Submitted two-page abstracts will be peer-reviewed,  
and after the review process, nearly 100 and 100 papers will be selected for oral and interactive poster presentations, respectively. Full papers are required to be submitted for all the accepted papers.

The details of the conference are listed below.

* Theme: SAR technology and applications for sustainability
* Date: Sunday, October 5 – Thursday, October 9, 2025
* Venue: Kunibiki Messe, Shimane Prefectural Convention Center
organizer: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers IEEE

title: Space Software Summit
description:
The **Space Software Summit**, scheduled for **October 6-8, 2025**, in **Boulder, Colorado**, is a premier engineering conference focused on advancements in aerospace software. This event will bring together industry leaders, engineers, and researchers to discuss cutting-edge developments and address challenges in the rapidly evolving field of space software.

Attendees will explore topics ranging from software design and systems engineering to mission-critical applications and emerging technologies. The summit serves as a hub for collaboration and innovation, driving progress in aerospace software to support the future of space exploration and technology.

title: Infrared Spectroscopy from Space
description:
Infrared Spectroscopy from Space: New Frontiers from Exoplanets to the Early Universe

This conference will bring together experts and enthusiasts of infrared spectroscopy to discuss the vast scientific potential unlocked by space-based infrared observations. From unraveling galaxy evolution across cosmic time to revealing the chemical compositions of star-forming regions and planetary systems, space spectroscopy offers an unparalleled window into the universe. Missions such as JWST, Euclid, SPHEREx, Roman and Ariel are, or soon will be, revolutionizing our ability to study the faintest and most distant objects, or acquire spectra orders of magnitude faster than previous telescopes.

The aim of the conference is to highlight the scientific breakthroughs enabled by these missions and explore synergies across distinct fields—from cosmology to planetary science—through shared methodologies or multi-purpose data sets. It will also strive to address the community’s research and collaboration needs, especially regarding large and complex datasets, while promoting the use of advanced data analysis techniques. An additional focus will be on exploring strategies to optimize future observational efforts, ensuring maximum scientific return from these missions.

title: AstroRob 2025: 8th Workshop on Robotic Autonomous Observatories
description:
Welcome to AstroRob 2025, the Eighth Workshop on Robotic Autonomous Observatories!

Sixteen years after the inaugural AstroRob workshop in Málaga, robotic and autonomous astronomical observatories have achieved remarkable advancements. The global number of automated facilities has grown substantially, along with their capabilities in robotization, autonomy, and networking. These developments, driven by the search for electromagnetic counterparts to gravitational waves (such as the groundbreaking detection in 2017), have profoundly influenced diverse areas of astrophysics and beyond, including:

* Fireball detection
* Minor planet studies
* Exoplanet searches
* Monitoring variable stars in the Galaxy
* Studying active galactic nuclei
* Supernova detection and monitoring
* Rapid follow-up of high-energy transients like gamma-ray bursts
* Electromagnetic counterparts to neutrino and gravitational waves

The workshop will also highlight the increasing importance of space debris surveillance and tracking, the observation of Near-Earth Objects, the role of robotic observatories in public outreach and education, and their contributions to open science.

The Scientific Organizing Committee aims to deliver a dynamic program addressing scientific, technical, educational, and outreach themes.

We encourage researchers, engineers, educators, and enthusiasts working in these fields to join us at AstroRob 2025. The success of this workshop series has been largely due to the active participation, insightful presentations, and engaging discussions contributed by its attendees. Your involvement is key to making the forthcoming workshop as fruitful and inspiring as previous editions.

AstroRob 2025 Workshop Topics

Workshop topics for the AstroRob 2025 Workshop on Robotic Autonomous Observatories include:

* Existing robotic observatories worldwide
* New hardware and software developments
* Real-time analysis pipelines
* Wide-field imaging and follow-ups
* Archiving the data and quality control
* Telescope and observatory control systems
* Transient detection and classification
* Protocols for robotic telescope networks
* Scientific results obtained by means of robotic observatories (from Solar System objects to high-energy transients in our Galaxy, gamma-ray bursts, neutrino sources and gravitational waves)
* Public Outreach and Citizen Science
* Global Networks
* Education applications
* Future strategies
* Space Debris Tracking and surveillance
* Near-Earth Objects observations

When

From 6 Oct to 10 Oct, 2025

Where

Hotel Barceló Cabo de Gata. El Toyo, Almería, Spain. This beautiful hotel is just 10 min away from Almería Airport and 2 hr from Málaga International Airport. A shuttle bus will be provided between Málaga Airport and the conference hotel.

title: Strategies in Satellite Ground Segment 2025 (SSGS 2025)
description:
The Strategies in Satellite Ground Segment 2025 (SSGS 2025) is the premier global event focused on ground station technology, hybrid network integration, and the future of satellite communications. As the satellite industry rapidly evolves, ground infrastructure must advance to support next-generation satellite constellations, AI-driven automation, and multi-orbit connectivity.

This two-day event will bring together leading experts, government officials, and telecom executives to discuss emerging trends, regulatory changes, and cutting-edge solutions that are reshaping satellite ground segment technology.

### **Key Themes & Expert Discussions**

#### **🚀 Ground Segment Transformation & Future Trends**

* Standardization, digitization, and virtualization of satellite ground systems
* The role of AI, cloud computing, and automation in modernizing ground operations
* Multi-orbit (GEO, MEO, LEO) networks and their impact on ground station infrastructure

#### **🛰️ Connectivity, Hybrid Networks & 5G/6G Integration**

* The future of 5G & 6G in satellite communications
* Multi-band, multi-orbit connectivity solutions for global enterprise and government users
* The satellite and telecom ecosystem – bridging connectivity gaps

#### **🌍 Regional Ground Systems & Earth Observation Advancements**

* Middle East, Africa, and Asia: Strengthening regional ground infrastructure
* Enhancing real-time access to geospatial data & analytics for commercial and governmental applications

### **Why Attend SSGS 2025?**

* Gain exclusive insights from world-leading experts in satellite ground infrastructure
* Engage in in-depth discussions on the impact of AI, 5G, and hybrid networks on satellite communications
* Connect with top industry players, government officials, and decision-makers shaping the future of satellite ground segments
* Discover emerging innovations in teleport technology, data centers, and cloud-based satellite operations
* Attend the Awards Gala & Evening Reception to network with industry leaders in an exclusive setting

title: SXSW Sydney
description:
Welcome to SXSW Sydney 2025!

South by Southwest Sydney® (SXSW Sydney) is thrilled to announce the dates for next year’s Conference, Expo and Festivals off the back of a successful 2024 Event.

The event in 2025 will run from October 13 to 19, in and around iconic precincts including Darling Harbour, Chippendale and Broadway.

SXSW Sydney Conference

The annual Conference provides a global stage for Asia-Pacific creators and professionals to showcase their talent and innovations.  
‍  
With more than 1,000 events and experiences, and attendees from 40+ countries, this is your gateway to global networking, collaboration, and exposure, solidifying Sydney as the Asia-Pacific’s creative hub. This year, conference content will be centrally located in three key venues: ICC Sydney, Novotel Sydney (Darling Square), and UTS Building 8.  
‍  
This is your chance to dive deep into [conference tracks](https://www.sxswsydney.com/conference#conference-tracks) covering the most important and timely topics of today. Spark fresh ideas through interactive sessions, workshops and talks that explore the future of entertainment, technology, and social impact. Discover groundbreaking innovations that are transforming the way we work and live.

SXSW Sydney in 2024

‍In 2024, the event returned to deliver 1,400 conference sessions, 95 screenings, 315 performances, 150 games and brand activations to 92,000+ unique attendees from 56 different countries, united by their desire for discovery and opportunity. This year’s Event saw over 300,000 visits across more than 1600 sessions and Events, over 7 days and 7 nights.

In 2024 we also introduced the launch of National AI Month and extended free programming in Tumbalong Park across 7 days with 163 Events, which were attended by over 190,000 people.

*Geoff Jones, Chair of SXSW Sydney said:*

“We are delighted to announce the dates for SXSW Sydney 2025, in partnership with the NSW Government.

“The event in 2024 was a great success on all fronts and was bigger than its debut year in attendance numbers and sessions throughout the week.

“We look forward to paving the way for more innovators across the tech and innovation, music, screen, games and creative industries by providing these creators with an opportunity on a Global stage.”

Mark your calendar for SXSW Sydney 2025

Submissions for the 2025 Conference, Music, Screen and Games Festival will open early in 2025.

Experience Sydney

Discover Sydney beyond the event with a week-long immersion in our vibrant harbourside city. As the events unfold, you’ll have the chance to connect with global leaders in tech and entertainment, and explore the diverse and dynamic local scene. Designed for all levels of interest and industry involvement, this is your opportunity to engage with Sydney’s rich offerings, celebrate creative breakthroughs, and experience the best our city has to offer. Join us to expand your horizons and dive into a week of groundbreaking discovery and celebration.

title: Exohost 2025 – Exploring Star-Planet-Disk Connections Conference
description:
Welcome to Exohost 2025!

We are pleased to announce the **Exohost 2025 – *Exploring Star-Planet-Disk Connections* Conference**, which will take place from **14–17 October 2025** at the University of Tartu Library, **Tartu, Estonia**.

This conference will focus on the intricate relationships between stars, planets, and disks, aiming to advance our understanding of these connections.

**Key Topics Include**:

* Chemical/composition links between stars, planets, and disks
* Stellar characterisation instruments and methods (photosphere and interior)
* Detailed characterisation of individual objects
* Science with large stellar surveys (APOGEE, LAMOST, 4MOST, etc.)
* Host star studies with meter-class telescopes
* Demographics & populations of stars and planets
* Formation of stars and their planetary systems
* Host stars in the era of JWST, E-ELT, PLATO, and other new facilities

**Important Dates:**

* February 26, 2025: Second announcement with call for abstracts and registration opening
* April 28, 2025: Abstract submission deadline
* October 14-17, 2025: Conference dates

**Email**: [exohost@ut.ee](mailto:exohost@ut.ee)

We look forward to welcoming you to Exohost 2025 in Tartu, Estonia!

title: Czech Space Week 2025
description:
Czech Space Week 2025 will span from October 20 to October 26 across multiple venues in the Czech Republic. This event stands as the largest and most comprehensive space festival in the country, uniting companies, startups, academics, and government stakeholders under a singular mission. Since its establishment in 2018, Czech Space Week has evolved into a critical platform designed to accelerate innovation, collaboration, and investment within the Czech and broader European space sectors.

**Core Events and Strategic Focus**
===================================

The festival features a curated lineup of events catering to industry professionals and the general public. The flagship **Space2Business** conference showcases collaborative opportunities, technological breakthroughs, and market trends shaping space-related enterprises, both domestically and internationally. Complementing this, the **Copernicus User Forum** convenes experts focusing on Earth observation technologies and their applications, emphasizing the region’s commitment to leveraging space data for environmental and security purposes.

Moreover, Czech Space Week highlights pressing themes such as space defense and international cooperation. A notable seminar titled “Defending European Interests in Space” addresses strategic challenges linked to space security, particularly in light of recent geopolitical tensions. The festival also fosters global dialogue by including sessions aimed at strengthening partnerships with Indo-Pacific space actors.

Empowering Diversity and Public Engagement

Czech Space Week actively promotes gender diversity through the **Space4Women** initiative. This platform spotlights female leadership and encourages greater inclusion across all space industry levels, from research to entrepreneurship. Public outreach remains vital, with educational workshops, exhibitions, and family-friendly programs designed to inspire youth and engage wider society.

The week culminates with the elegant **Space Gala**, celebrating achievements and fostering networking among key players in government, industry, and academia. This multifaceted approach ensures that Czech Space Week functions as more than a conference: it serves as a vibrant nexus where innovation meets policy, and science intersects with commerce.

### Czech Republic’s Ascending Role in Space

The Czech Republic distinguishes itself as one of the most successful newcomers within the European Space Agency (ESA), actively contributing to around 500 ESA projects. Its strengths lie in satellite technology, launch vehicle development, and Earth observation missions. Czech companies and subcontractors are highly engaged in these domains, demonstrating a competitive edge alongside Western European nations.

By hosting such a diverse and well-structured festival, Czech Space Week fortifies the country’s position as a dynamic and influential player in the global space economy. The 2025 edition not only spotlights national achievements but also accelerates strategic partnerships and innovation transfer, aligning with Europe’s broader space ambitions.
organizer: Ministry of Transport of the Czech Republic

title: 7th SWF Summit for Space Sustainability
description:
🌐 Overview of the 7th Summit for Space Sustainability

Join us in Paris, France on 22–23 October 2025 for the 7th Summit for Space Sustainability, co-hosted by the Secure World Foundation (SWF), the Centre National d’Études Spatiales (CNES), and the French Government. This high‑level, multi‑day international forum focuses on developing concrete solutions to sustain safe, secure, and peaceful uses of outer space

Watch our exclusive Space Agenda TV interview, where Remco Timmermans talks to Krystal Azelton of SWF about why everyone should attend the event:

Why Attend?

▶️ Theme: “Acting with Intention: Stability, Sustainability, and Benefit” – This year’s summit centres on this guiding theme, shining a spotlight on regional and global initiatives in space sustainability

### 🎯 Key Topics Include:

Latest international policy developments and governance frameworks

* Atmospheric impacts of space activities
* Security, safety, and stability in orbit
* Growth of commercial space sustainability services
* Role of space applications in addressing Earth’s climate and development challenges

Who Should Attend?

Space is no longer the domain of a few. Whether you’re in government, industry, academia, civil society, or a student passionate about space policy and sustainability, this summit is for everyone. The event is structured to facilitate inclusive engagement—from policymakers and CEOs to researchers and young professionals. Live Q&A, spotlight talks, and interactive panels ensure all voices are heard

### Young Professionals & Scholarships

SWF places strong emphasis on the next generation. Young professionals benefit from discounted registration, mentorship sessions, and dedicated networking events. Scholarships, including for students, ensure broad participation

Venue & Format

📍 Centre de Conférences Pierre Mendès France, Paris  
📅 22–23 October 2025 (with a welcome evening on 21 Oct evening)

Hybrid format: attend in‑person or virtually, with interactive features via the Whova app—streaming and real‑time engagement in CET timezone

Benefits & Networking

* Connect with global leaders from government, private sector, and NGOs
* Gain insights on emerging challenges through keynote addresses and dynamic panels
* Explore new markets, including space-based environmental services
* Build partnerships and stay ahead of regulatory and technological shifts
* Strengthen skills—mentorship, policy-shaping, and professional growth

How to Register & Learn More

Visit [swfsummit.org](https://swfsummit.org) for full agenda, speaker bios, tickets (including student/YP discounts), and sponsorship details

* Press and media can register for free.
* Sponsorship packages are available for organisations seeking prime visibility and strategic networking

Don’t Miss the Video

For a deeper dive into what the summit offers—and why you should be part of the conversation—watch the insightful interview with Krystal Azelton on Space Agenda TV: Remco Timmermans explores the event’s goals, participants, and impact. Your first glimpse at the summit’s potential is just a click away!

In Summary

The 7th Summit for Space Sustainability Paris 2025 is a critical gathering for anyone engaged in space policy, sustainability, or innovation. With a powerful theme—\*“Acting with Intention: Stability, Sustainability, and Benefit”—\*this summit drives action on pressing global challenges. Secure your place in Paris or online—together, we can shape a sustainable space future for all.

title: 71st International Congress of Aviation and Space Medicine ICASM 2025
description:
71st International Congress of 
Aviation and Space Medicine

ICASM 2025 in Singapore aims to unite the international community of aviation and space medicine professionals, scientists, researchers, and practitioners in collectively bringing aviation and space medicine to greater heights through professional exchanges and closer collaborations. The conference theme “Soaring Towards New Horizons in Aviation and Space Medicine” epitomizes the compelling and forward-looking scientific programme that will highlight the latest advancements and emerging trends in aviation and space medicine and other related fields.

I am excited and honored to share that the 71st International Congress of Aviation and Space Medicine (ICASM) will take place in Singapore from October 27-30, 2025.

ICASM 2025 aims to unite the international community of aviation and space medicine practicioners, scientists, academicians and researchers in the sunny island of Singapore for an unforgettable experience of learning, networking and collaboration. ICASM 2025 will include a rich scientific programme spanning over 3 days as well as unique visits and tours on the last day.

The theme for ICASM 2025 is “Soaring Towards New Horizons in Aviation and Space Medicine”. My team and I will be curating a compelling and forward-looking scientific programme that will highlight the latest advancements and emerging trends in aviaiton and space medicine, as well as other related fields. We look forward to your valued contribution as presenters, sponosrs and participants.

The congress will be held at One Farrer Hotel, situated in one of Singapore’s cultural districts. The location of this hotel holds historical significance as the first flight in Singapore took off here. On 16 March 1911, a Bristol Boxkite biplane took flight from the old Race Course at Farrer Park, the site which sits adjacent to this hotel.

One Farrer Hotel boasts a plethora of water and tropical gardens within its compounds, and also has a fully operational farm which provides greens in the food it serves. This provides a distinctive and inspiring backdrop for the conference, and showcases Singapore as a Garden City for all to enjoy.

Singapore is home to a global metropolis, a City in Nature, and a rich tapestry of rich and diverse cultures. During your stay in Singapore and as part of ICASM 2025, you will be introduced to a wide variety of food and cuisines, a stunning city skyline, and plenty of sunshine.

I would like to extend a warm welcome to friends from all around the world to join me in Singapore for ICASM 2025. With an exciting lineup of events and activities, I am certain you will have an unforgettable experience. See you in Singapore!

Dr. Benjamin Tan (Singapore

Chairman,

Organizing Committee  
ICASM 2025

title: 9th IEEE RADIO International Conference
description:
Welcome to IEEE RADIO 2025!

The 9th edition of IEEE RADIO will be held from 27th to 30th October 2025 in Flic-en-Flac, Mauritius. The aim of the conference is to discuss recent developments, theories and practical applications covering the whole scope of radio frequency engineering, including radio waves, antennas, propagation and electromagnetic compatibility.

Prospective authors are invited to submit original contributions on their latest research activities. Student papers are strongly encouraged. IEEE RADIO 2025 will feature three Best Student Paper Awards, a Young Scientist Award and an Industrial Engineering Paper Award. Proposals for special sessions, workshops and tutorials are welcome. A panel of distinguished researchers will deliver keynote speeches/invited talks on recent technology trends and advances.

IEEE Radio 2025 topics

Topics for this conference include:

* Antenna theory
* Wave propagation and scattering
* Electromagnetic compatibility
* Analytical and numerical methods
* Smart antennas and arrays
* RF components and systems
* Wireless communication systems
* Biological effects
* Radio astronomy
* Wireless power transfer
* Devices and circuits
* Nanotechnology
* Remote sensing
* High-power devices and techniques
* Instrumentation and measurement techniques
* Medical and industrial applications of electromagnetic fields
* Modeling, simulation, computer aided design
* Electronic packaging and integration
* Metamaterials and other novel materials
organizer: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers IEEE

title: International School on Space Optics ISSO 2025
description:
**ISSO 2025 will take place from 27 – 31 October 2025 at ESA-ESTEC in Noordwijk, the Netherlands.**

What is it?

The International School on Space Optics is an event that targets to serve the community of young engineers and scientists who are already active or have the aspiration to work in the field of Spaceborne Optics. It offers an intensive 5-days immersion program of lectures, design project and visits to space-related facilities. The course can be seen as a “compressed” 1-year class on Space Optics which would have been part of a Master Program in Spaceborne Technologies and Applications. It will allow 360 degrees exposure to all disciplines or optical engineering in space. A Certificate of Attendance will be provided to any participant that has been present consistently throughout the Course.

The first ISSO was organised as a “Winter College on Space Optics” in February 2015 at the UNESCO International Centre for Theoretical Physics – ICTP within the frame of the “2015-International Year of Light”.  Following this event it was decided to establish the ISSO as a systematic biannual event. In 2017 the ISSO was hosted at ESTEC. In 2019 the ISSO was hosted at ENEA in Rome, Italy. And ISSO 2021 was hosted online.

In 2025 the School will be held only physically in ESTEC with no option for on-line attendance.

Code of Conduct

The school organization is committed to providing an environment that is conducive to the free and robust exchange of scientific ideas. This environment requires that all participants be treated with equal consideration and respect. The participants are therefore expected to conduct themselves professionally and respectfully. All forms of bullying, discrimination, and harassment are prohibited. This policy applies to every individual at the event, whether attendee, speaker or other.

How many people will participate?

80 people will participate in ISSO 2025. The selection is based on merit and expected benefit for the student.

Why we do it?

Engineers and Scientists working on any discipline of spaceborne optics tend frequently to be very specialised in the narrow field of their first work missing opportunities in serving other disciplines. Also, optical engineers who have not yet engaged in any kind of activity in Space do not have a complete understanding of where their skills could be applied. The school will provide a 360- degree overview of the broad area of Space Optics covering Applications, Instrumentation and Technologies opening hence the horizons and opportunities for the young engineers/scientists to assess better all available opportunities.

ISSO is a sister event of the International Conference on Space Optics – ICSO and it is organised biannually in alternative years than ICSO.

The ICSO proceedings are freely and readily available on the ICSO proceedings site of the SPIE Digital Library.

CEAS Space Journal

The CEAS Space Journal includes a distinct field on “Optical, Optoelectronics and Photonics” and welcomes papers of ICSO in an extended version of the conference paper including theoretical analysis. Consider an electronic submission through the Journal [website](https://www.springer.com/journal/12567).

How much will it cost?

Thanks to the support of sponsors the fees for the students will be kept to a minimum registration fee.

Who should attend?

Young engineers or scientists with a background in any field of Optics, Optoelectronics or Photonics. Background should be demonstrated by:

* a Masters or PhD degree in any Optics discipline
* actively pursuing a PhD in any Optics discipline
* working as a researcher in any Optics discipline in a university or research centre or industry

Without having a strict age limit it is expected that the participants will be in generally younger than 40 years old and with limited experience in the field of Space Optics.

Certificate of Attendance

At the conclusion of the School a “Certificate of Attendance” signed by the School Directors, will be awarded to all students attending the full programme of lectures and visits.

Academic accreditation

Academic institutions can recognize the School for its merit. Notice that the University of Padova’s PhD course on Sciences Technologies and Measurements for Space (STMS) [PhD Course – Dottorato | CISAS “G.Colombo” (unipd.it)](https://protect-eu.mimecast.com/s/QHywCAngcyYm3vt8JPFy) accredits the ISSO with 2 Credit units ([https://www.study.eu/article/what-is-the-ects-european-credit-transfer-and-accumulation-system](https://protect-eu.mimecast.com/s/fBMqCBgjCQoZ9gUNU6Ib)).

Young Space Optics Professionals

Why don’t you ask our “alumnae” for a first hand account of what to expect from attending ISSO. [LinkedIn Link of YSOP.](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/9093885/)

title: ISAP 2025 International Symposium on Antennas and Propagation
description:
Welcome to ISAP 2025

Welcome to the 2025 International Symposium on Antennas and Propagation (ISAP2025) in Fukuoka, Japan, from October 27 to 31, 2025

The ISAP is a series of annual international symposium for the exchange on research and development in antennas, propagation, electromagnetic-wave theory, and other related fields. The first ISAP was held in Sendai in 1971, and this is the 30th time. The ISAP series have become absolutely one of major international conferences in the fields of Antennas and Propagation in the world.

This symposium is sponsored and organized by the Communications Society of the Institute of Electronics, Information and Communications Engineers (IEICE), and will be held in cooperation with the Antenna Measurement Techniques Association (AMTA), the Antennas and Propagation Society of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE/AP-S), the Antennas Society of the Chinese Institute of Electronics (AS-CIE), the Electrical Engineering/Electronics, Computer, Communications, Information Technology Association of Thailand (ECTI), the European Association on Antennas and Propagation (EurAAP), the Institute of Antenna Engineers of Taiwan, the International Union of Radio Science (URSI), the Korean Institute of Electromagnetic Engineering and Science (KIEES), and the Taiwan Microwave Association.

Conference Topics

This symposium will treat a wide range of subjects on antennas, propagation and electromagnetic-wave theory as suggested below. Papers concerned with other aspects of these subjects will also be considered. In addition, special topics treating emerging technologies heralding a new era in wireless communications and applications are invited for consideration.

### A. Antennas

A1 Small Antennas and RF Sensors  
A2 Antennas for Mobile and V2X Applications  
A3 Broadband and Multi-band Antennas  
A4 Smart and Reconfigurable Antennas  
A5 Reflector and Reflectarray Antennas  
A6 Planar/Printed Antennas and Arrays  
A7 Antenna Theory and Design  
A8 Antenna Measurements  
A9 Millimeter-wave, Terahertz and Optical Antennas  
A10 Metamaterials and Metasurfaces for Antennas

### B. Propagation

B1 Indoor and Mobile Propagation  
B2 Millimeter-wave, Terahertz and Optical Propagation  
B3 Propagation for V2X and IoT  
B4 Channel Sounding and Channel Estimation  
B5 Propagation for HAPS and UAV  
B6 Remote Sensing  
B7 Terrestrial, Earth-Space and Ionospheric Propagation  
B8 Underwater Communication  
B9 Propagation Measurement Techniques

### C. Electromagnetic-wave Theory

C1 Computational Electromagnetics  
C2 Time-Domain Techniques  
C3 Scattering, Diffraction and RCS  
C4 Inverse and Imaging Techniques  
C5 Optimization Methods in EM Problems  
C6 Passive and Active Components  
C7 Frequency Selective Surfaces and Filters  
C8 EBG, Metamaterials and Periodic Structures

### D. AP-related Topics

D1 RIS and Antenna Systems for Wireless Communications  
D2 MIMO and Array Signal Processing  
D3 AP-related Topics for B5G and 6G  
D4 Wireless Power Transfer Technologies  
D5 Wearable Device Networks and Medical Applications  
D6 ML and AI for AP Applications  
D7 RFID and Its Applications  
D8 EMC/EMI Technologies  
D9 DOA/TOF Estimation, Localization, Sensing and Radar

title: European Space Weather Week ESWW 2025
description:
The 21st edition of the major international conference, European Space Weather Week ESWW 2025 will take place in Umeå in the autumn of 2025. The event is expected to attract at least 500 participants from diverse sectors around the world, including academia, industry and governmental agencies.

The ESWW will mainly be organised by Umeå University with the help of Umeå Congress and a national scientific team.

“Umeå University is honoured to have been selected to host this prestigious event. The ESWW is an important platform for sharing knowledge, discussing the latest research, and exploring new frontiers in space weather and space climate forecasting and technology,” says Audrey Schillings, chair of the organising committee.

The ESWW aims to foster interdisciplinary collaboration and investigation of new technologies and approaches, such as machine learning, in a space weather and space climate context. The event is highly interdisciplinary and brings scientists together with space industries and actors interested in space weather and space climate.

A diverse range of events will mark the conference, including a summer school for students and early-career scientists, an exhibition fair, and engaging activities designed for children and the public.

The conference is scheduled for October 27 to 31, 2025, marking the first occasion this annual gathering will be hosted in Sweden.

About space weather

Space weather refers to the constantly changing conditions in space depending on the solar activity. Solar winds and solar flares are some of the main drivers for space weather events.

Space weather affects technological systems, both on Earth and in space, such as satellites, air traffic and electrical systems.

title: Software Defined Space Conference SDSC 2025
description:

title: COSPAR 2025 Symposium
description:
The Committee on Space Research (COSPAR) is proud to announce the COSPAR 2025 Scientific Symposium in cooperation with the Cyprus Space Exploration Organisation (CSEO).

This Symposium, themed “Space Exploration 2025: A Symposium on Humanity’s Challenges and Celestial Solutions”, will delve into critical global challenges such as climate change, resource depletion, and space weather, while exploring how space exploration and technology can offer solutions. It will present various matters related to ongoing and planned space programs, fostering discussions on international collaboration, ethical considerations, and the role of emerging nations in space exploration.

The event will bring together a diverse audience from around the world, including representatives from space and non-space companies, space agencies, international organizations, researchers, and the wider public.

Statement by the COSPAR President

“COSPAR’s mission is unique, bridging together both spacefaring and non-spacefaring nations offering them the opportunity to play a role in its realization. There is no other organization on the international scene having such a mission.

Our global role of fostering international space cooperation and peace – is aiming to establish a common level playing field.”

Pascale Ehrenfreund  
President, COSPAR

title: CADC Connecticut Aerospace & Defense Conference
description:
Welcome to The Connecticut Aerospace & Defense Conference CADC 2025!

The Connecticut Aerospace & Defense Conference (CADC) is a B2B event with focus on supply chain, manufacturing capabilities, services, and technologies with applications in aerospace and defense. CADC is exclusively based on BCI Aerospace’s signature matchmaking format and reserved for vetted professionals. CADC is an opportunity for suppliers, service providers, engineering, supply chain, procurement, product development teams to connect through pre-arranged meetings.

The sessions will feature executives and leaders covering commercial and military programs at Collins, Pratt & Whitney, and Raytheon. Each leader will address various key topics: trends, challenges and opportunities in market segments, expectations from suppliers, manufacturing automation, information integration.

title: Security for Space Systems (3S)
description:
***2025 Security for Space Systems (3S)*** Conference aims at bringing together academia and industry to present cutting-edge research and innovations in space systems security.

After the success of its inaugural edition, the 2025 conference will expand to include two review cycles and extend to two and a half days, ensuring ample time for in-depth discussions and engagement, to exchange knowledge on the latest security challenges and solutions for space.

In addition to the conference, there will be an industrial exhibition where European companies specializing in space systems security are invited to demonstrate their products through equipment displays or informative posters. This exhibition will offer a unique opportunity to connect with industry professionals, researchers, and stakeholders from the broader security community.

The Security for Space Systems 2025 will be held **in November 2025 at the European Space Research and Technology Centre (ESTEC)** in Noordwijk, the Netherlands.

Conference Topics

Innovative and research-driven submissions are solicited in, but not limited to, the following topics:

* Applied crypto for space.
* Avionics (spacecraft) security (security of avionics busses, on board data handling, processors, etc.).
* Ground segment security.
* RF jamming and anti-jamming techniques.
* Security at System level.
* Security for “New Space” and mega-constellations.
* Security of optical space communications.
* Security of space communication protocols (e.g. CCSDS).
* Security of satcom systems (e.g. 5G NTN, DVB-S2, etc.).
* Security of space relays and interplanetary missions.
* Security Policies for space.
* Security assurance, accreditation, and certification
* Software security for Space Systems

Conference Location

The conference will be located in ESA ESTEC (European Space Research and Technology Centre), in Noordwijk, The Netherlands. ESTEC is the largest site and the technical heart of the European Space Agency.

A digital leaflet with the map and safety&security information is available here: <https://esamultimedia.esa.int/docs/ESTEC/ESTEC_Safety_and_Security_Leaflet.pdf>. The presentations rooms and the restaurant are located in the A building (yellow).

European Space Research & Technology Centre  
Keplerlaan 1  
Postbus 299  
2200 AG Noordwijk (The Netherlands)

title: The Space Economy Summit 2025
description:
The Space Economy Summit 2025 gathers global leaders, entrepreneurs, and investors to discuss the booming multibillion-dollar space economy sector. This annual summit focuses on new market opportunities, emerging technologies, investments, and regulatory frameworks driving the next wave of space industrialization. Attendees benefit from expert panels, strategic networking, and visionary keynotes.

Exploring Expanding Market Opportunities

Participants will explore diverse opportunities across satellite communications, space tourism, space mining, data analytics, and Earth observation, which collectively fuel rapid sector growth. Moreover, the summit features detailed updates on government programs, commercial launch services, and innovative startups shaping the competitive landscape. Highlighting Innovative Technologies and Investments

The event showcases cutting-edge advancements in propulsion systems, reusable launch vehicles, satellite constellations, and in-orbit manufacturing. Additionally, investment forums connect venture capitalists, private equity, and public markets with promising space enterprises poised for scaling. This dynamic environment accelerates commercial space ventures while addressing regulatory and financial hurdles.

Shaping Policy and Partnership Ecosystems

The Space Economy Summit actively promotes dialogue on regulatory reforms, international cooperation, and sustainable space utilization guidelines. It brings together policymakers, industry experts, and academia to develop harmonized frameworks enabling safe and responsible space activities. Furthermore, the summit encourages public-private partnerships crucial for pioneering ambitious space projects globally.

For professionals engaged in space-related industries, the Space Economy Summit presents unmatched opportunities to gain insights, build alliances, and shape the sector’s future. Attending this summit is essential for navigating the complex dynamics that will define space’s role in global economic growth and innovation for decades to come.

title: Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering MBSE 2025
description:
Welcome to the Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering Workshop MBSE 2025

Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering (MB4SE) workshop is heading to Lithuania in 2025! 🚀

With the support of the MB4SE Advisory Group, and [Sensmetry](https://www.linkedin.com/company/sensmetry/), this prestigious event will further strengthen the Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) community across the European space domain. And what better place to host it than Vilnius – the vibrant capital of one of ESA’s Associated Member States!

📅 Save the Date: 5-7, November 2025  
📍 Where: Vilnius, Lithuania

The call for workshops is already open! Submit your proposals by 15 March 2025.

We look forward to welcoming the MBSE community to Vilnius and showcasing Lithuania’s commitment to innovation and the space sector! 💡🌌

Call for Workshop and Training Session Proposals during MBSE2025 Vilnius

Space Hub LT at Innovation Agency Lithuania, the European Space Agency, in cooperation with the Model Based for System Engineering Advisory Group, and Sensmetry are excited to announce an open call for workshops and training sessions proposals to be featured at MBSE 2025 (5-7 Nov 2025, Vilnius). This multi-day event will bring together experts, practitioners, and enthusiasts for immersive training and collaborative work focused on Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) with a specific focus on the space domain.

We invite proposals that emphasize practical learning, hands-on interaction, group work and engaging discussions.

**​Event objectives: Accelerating the adoption and use of MBSE in the space domain**

#### Lowering adoption barriers

* How can we improve usability (visualization, analysis, reporting), emphasizing decision support aspects
* What is the migration path (existing projects, existing data, existing processes, MBSE applied in specific context)

#### Empowering the workforce

* What skills are required (re-training, coaching, champions,…), bridging the gap between domain knowledge and MBSE expertise
* Changing roles (interaction engineer – system engineer – project manager) and re-prioritize our use-cases as a function of experiences

#### Integration of tools and processes

* Where do we need interoperability, and why
* Enabling domain-specific activities in digital engineering workflows

How do we bridge the gap between top down (semantic definitions / ontologies) and bottom up (data exchange formats, tool focus)? How to bridge the gap between left and right-side of the V-model?

### Session Types and Format​

Timeslots are available either as 1 hour or 2.5-hour slots for individual sessions. Larger sessions can be proposed by combining multiple 2.5h slots (at most three).

### We are seeking proposals for:

* Training Sessions: sessions focusing on MBSE tools, languages, and methodologies. Training sessions are intended to provide participants with skills and insights they can directly apply to their MBSE projects, focused on space mission development.​
* Workshops: sessions (individually or in combined blocks) that encourage participant involvement and discussion. We encourage a broad interpretation of “workshop” and welcome the following formats:

1. Collaborative Group Work: Structured group exercises focusing on MBSE topics, addressing practical problems or other common challenges.​
2. Tool Application Sessions: Practical, hands-on workshops where participants work on MBSE projects or problems using specific tools or methodologies.​
3. Hackathons: Time-boxed challenges on MBSE problems or tasks, which may include a pre-workshop preparation phase and/or follow-up work (e.g. a pitch presentation at the end of the last day).​
4. Roundtable Discussions: Facilitated discussions where participants can share perspectives, solutions, and insights on MBSE-related issues.​
5. Other: We welcome unique approaches to MBSE education and collaboration. Feel free to propose innovative formats that you believe will engage participants effectively.​
