title: Startup Startcamp Bremen SPACE
description:
**FROM IDEA TO STARTUP IN 54 HOURS**

**About STARTUP STARTCAMP BREMEN SPACE**

STARTUP STARTCAMP BREMEN SPACE is designed for those who are interested to (co-)start a SPACE, SPACE-ENABLED, or SPACE-RELATED startup:

* Transform a space or space-enabled or space-related startup idea in just 54 hours!
* Pitch your idea in 60 seconds (no slides) or join an idea that you are passionate about.
* Find awesome like-minded people, grow your network & learn new skills.
* Test your assumptions, conduct market research, tune your business model, develop your demo or prototype.
* On Sunday, pitch your startup concept to a jury & public audience, get feedback – and maybe your own startup will be born this weekend!

Please find the examples of how this event format has paved the path for two startups in these LinkedIn posts: [Valispace post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-bremen-startup-activity-7120808176072941569-rg3y "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-bremen-startup-activity-7120808176072941569-rg3y") & [WasteAnt post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_bremenstartups-bremen-startup-activity-7121106185902010369-QME5 "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_bremenstartups-bremen-startup-activity-7121106185902010369-QME5").

For all event details, please check the following**FAQ, event schedule, video & lineup**:

**1)****WHY Startup Startcamp Bremen SPACE?**

Bremen is a European SPACE hotspot with 140 companies, € 4 Billion annual revenue, 20 top research institutions , 12.000 people employed and host of Europe’s largest B2B space event – the [Space Tech Expo Euro](https://www.spacetechexpo-europe.com/ "https://www.spacetechexpo-europe.com/")– which starts just two days after the Startup Startcamp (2024, Nov. 19-21).

Bremen also has a vibrant startup & tech community as well.  
Since 2015, the [#BremenStartups](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=bremenstartups "https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=bremenstartups") community has a proven track record on facilitating startups & entrepreneurial journeys.

And it works! There have been founded above a dozen of Startups from previous events like Startup Startcamp Bremen SPACE! These events were the initial starting point for attendees to go for their entrepreneurial journey and launch startups like Valispace, satsearch, SPiN, or Jelly Space!

**2)**BUT I’M NOT A SPACE ENGINEER OR SCIENTIST!**Is that event for me?**

SURE!  
Because STARTUP STARTCAMP works by a variety of skills and experiences.

Wether you are…  
…idea giver or ar a potential co-founder…  
…professional or student…  
… designer / creative, software or hardware developer, business or industry expert…  
… you will be valuable for your team at STARTUP STARTCAMP!

**3)****Will I get support?**

You are not alone! Experienced founders, experts & coaches will support you (check the out below). Also food & drinks are included in your ticket so that you can focus and concentrate on your project.

**4)****Should everyone pitch startup ideas?**

It is entirely your choice to pitch a startup idea or join the team of an idea you believe in. Either ways, we want you to enjoy this exhilarating experience of building startups. Your idea should be something you have not previously worked on. **Please find the TOP 10 input about the idea pitches in**[**this LinkedIn Post.**](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-pitchfire-bremen-activity-7120076651849244672-j8nc "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-pitchfire-bremen-activity-7120076651849244672-j8nc")

**5)****What is the language of the event?**

The event moderation and all pitches will be in English. You can discuss with your teammates and mentors in the language of your choice.

**6)****Do I register only myself or do I have to register as a startup team?**

Register yourself. You can’t register as a team. Don’t worry if you don’t know anyone attending. We will help everyone form groups, and there will be lots of possibilities to mingle and get to know other attendees.

**7)****How big are the teams?**

Teams of 4 to 5 members are the ideal number for optimal results.

**8)****What do I need to bring?**

A laptop and a desire to contribute! You must be able to attend Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

**9)****I’m not from Bremen. Can you recommend accommodation close to the event location?**

The eventlocation ([DIGITAL INDUSTRY HUB BREMEN](https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/ "https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/"), Konrad-Zuse-Straße 6a, 28359 Bremen) is embedded in the technology park of the University Bremen.

Thus, the DHI is very easy to be reached by public transport. The station “Lise-Meitner-Straße” is just five minutes walk distance from the DHI and is served quite frequently by various tram & bus lines. E.g. the tram line #6 needs just twelve minutes from the main train station to the DHI.

Thus, you can find several hotels in the area around the DHI, but if you are looking for other accomendation options in Bremen, the public transportation makes it possible to easliy get from there to the DHI.

Please check also the “Getting there” infos for bike, scooter, car & public transport on the page of the DHI here: [https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/contact-us-getting-here/](https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/contact-us-getting-here/ "https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/contact-us-getting-here/")

**10) What is included in the ticket price?**

Your ticket includes food, drinks, and one-on-one time with amazing mentors over the course of the weekend.

Please check thankfully the awesome supporters of [bremen-startups.de](https://www.bremen-startups.de/ "https://www.bremen-startups.de/") who semi-sponsor the tickets so that we can provide you more value than what you actually pay for.

**ATTENDEE TICKETS are limited to 50 tickets in total!**

First come, first serve. Don’t wait to the last day to book your ticket 😉

* **ATTENDEE TICKETs**  
  – SUPER EARLY BIRD tickets for €25 -> are limited to the first 10 bookings.  
  – EARLY BIRD tickets for €40 -> will be available for bookings #11-30  
  – REGULAR tickets for €55 – > will be available for bookings #31-40  
  – LATE BIRD tickets for €70 – > will be available for bookings #41-50
* **VISITOR TICKET**(5 Euro):Just wanna watch the final pitches on Sunday, Nov 17, 16:30h – 20:00h? Get a **VISITOR** ticket (limited to 50 tickets).

Check the **SCHEDULE & LINEUP BELOW** to get an impression about STARTUP STARTCAMP BREMEN!

Any questions, please email [Jan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jan-wessels/ "https://www.linkedin.com/in/jan-wessels/") at: jan.wessels@bremen-startups.de

title: 7th Shaw-IAU Workshop on Astronomy for Education
description:
The **7th Shaw-IAU Workshop on Astronomy for Education** is a fully virtual event that will take place from **November 18-21, 2025**. Hosted by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) Office of Astronomy for Education (OAE), this global event is designed to advance astronomy education at primary, secondary, and university levels.

### **Who Should Attend?**

This workshop is ideal for educators, researchers, and educational policymakers involved in astronomy education. Whether you teach primary school students, guide university-level educators, or develop curriculum materials, the event offers a unique opportunity to exchange ideas and collaborate with experts worldwide.

### **Key Highlights**

1. **Focus on Astronomy Education:**
   * Explore innovative teaching methods and tools for astronomy education in schools.
   * Learn from successful practices in teacher training and classroom implementation.
2. **Specialized Science and Education Sessions:**
   * **Science Focus:** Galaxies – Gain insights into teaching astronomy concepts using cutting-edge scientific discoveries.
   * **Education Focus:** Teaching with authentic data – Learn how to integrate real astronomical data into classroom activities.
3. **Multilingual Accessibility:**
   * Presentations and posters are welcome in any language, with English subtitles or translations for accessibility.
   * Regional and special language sessions will be available to foster global collaboration.

### **Why Attend?**

Supported by the Shaw Prize Foundation, Klaus Tschira Foundation, and Carl Zeiss Foundation, this workshop continues its tradition of excellence in advancing global astronomy education. Attendees will gain tools and strategies to inspire the next generation of astronomers, making complex topics accessible and engaging for students.

Join this transformative event to connect with a global network of educators and researchers.

title: LATSAT 2025
description:
Welcome to LATSAT 2025: Gathering Latin America’s Space Industry Leaders!

LATSAT, organized by Novaspace, is the premier forum that unites senior-ranking public and private decision-makers from the satcom, connectivity, and Earth observation sectors in Latin America. This unique event provides an unparalleled platform to network, explore sector advancements, and foster business opportunities.

About LATSAT 2025

Wishing to establish yourself or further develop your activity in the Latin American satcom, connectivity, or Earth observation market, then this is the must-attend event for you. LATSAT will allow you to take advantage of the growth potential in the region by providing insights on what is in the pipeline and where opportunities lie and will enable you to connect with key industry players.

Who attends?

LATSAT welcomes 200+ executive-level participants from Latin America and beyond.

Programme

The two-day program will be rhythmed by high-level keynotes speeches and thematic round tables featuring 40+ high-level government officials and industry executive speakers from Latin America and the rest of the world.

The program reflects perspectives and insights on the most critical issues facing the industry today. Amongst the topics addressed are Universal Access, national security, space programs & public/private collaboration, Earth observation, national broadband connectivity, the digital ecosystem, smallsat opportunities, manufacturer solutions, VSAT services, and digital ground solutions.

LATSAT 2025 Value Proposition

### Join the entire space ecosystem

Join 200+ public and private senior-ranking decision makers from the satcom, connectivity, and Earth observation sectors. LATSAT will gather the industry key players including satellite manufacturers, launchers, ground service providers, satellite and telecommunication operators and broadband service providers, national space agencies and governmental entities for two days of high-level debates, exchanges, and business meetings.

### Learn from and be inspired by the top minds​

Hear 40+ high-level business leaders sharing industry perspectives, best practices, and how challenges become opportunities. LATSAT’s program will initiate discussions on the regional and global markets most relevant issues, as well as on prospects and challenges for the Latin American market in a global setting. The debates will reflect market dynamics and address lessons learnt, stimulate innovation and allow attendees to stay up to date with market trends, leaving the event fully equipped for future business adventures.

### Take your business to the next level

Connect with 200+ senior-ranking decision makers during the exclusive social events organized as part of the event. LATSAT offers a world class opportunity for public and private Latin American space stakeholders to meet, network, share lessons learnt, and plan the development of their business in Latin America with regional and global counterparts.

Novaspace: Connecting Industry Leaders

Since 1997, Novaspace has been at the forefront of organizing the most prestigious and renowned events and thematic conferences within the space industry. These gatherings bring together the world’s leading decision-makers to benchmark progress, exchange views, gain valuable market insights, foster existing or potential partnerships, and seal important deals.

title: Space-Comm Expo Scotland
description:
Space-Comm Expo Scotland at SEC Glasgow is the new catalyst for one of the world’s leading space nations at the forefront of the UK’s global ambitions.  
The Scottish space industry is thriving and one of the fastest growing in Europe. Glasgow designs and builds more small satellites than anywhere outside of California. Scotland is home to five spaceports aiming to be a strategic launchpad for the northern hemisphere with multiple launch vehicle operators. Scotland is famous for world class downstream data capabilities, technology for deep space missions and is home to over 150+ space companies with the sector underpinned by government, business, clusters and universities.

Space-Comm Expo Scotland is supported by the Scottish Government, UK Space Agency, UKspace, Scottish Enterprise, South of Scotland Enterprise, Highlands and Islands Enterprise and Space Scotland with plans to attract international delegations and visitors from across Europe and the global space community, alongside Primes, SMEs and Start-Ups.

Space-Comm Expo Scotland will follow the award-winning format of previous events with Scottish based companies to the fore alongside international exhibitors, product demonstrations, keynote speakers, multiple conference theatres, roundtables and 1-2-1 networking opportunities.

A future-focused platform

From satellite platform primes, satellite operators, military, government and application developers, this free to attend exhibition and leading seminar will encapsulate the growing space ecosystem, focusing on the small satellite revolution, the internationalisation of the value chain, the acceleration of spaceports and the increasing commercialisation of the sector.

Did you know?

150+ space companies currently operate from Scotland, including renowned global and emerging companies and operating costs can be up to 40% lower in Scotland than elsewhere in the UK. Space-Comm Expo Scotland will provide a valuable opportunity for the sector to display each area of the supply chain to buyers with active and growing budgets, and drive future workforce.

Where?

As the place that makes more satellites than anywhere else in the world outside of California, Space-Comm Expo Scotland will take place at SEC Glasgow, 3-4 December 2025

title: Airspace Asia Pacific 2025
description:
Airspace Asia Pacific 2025: Shaping the Future of Airspace Management

Join us for the inaugural **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025**, a groundbreaking exhibition and conference dedicated to advancing air traffic management (ATM) and unmanned traffic management (UTM) across the Asia Pacific region. Scheduled for **December 9-11, 2025**, at the **AsiaWorld-Expo in Hong Kong**, this event promises to be a pivotal gathering for industry leaders, policymakers, and innovators.

Uniting the Airspace Community

The **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025** event, organized by [CANSO](https://canso.org/), will bring together over **100 exhibitors** and representatives from more than **50 key Air Navigation Service Providers (ANSPs)** across **100 countries**. This unique platform will showcase cutting-edge technologies and innovations designed to address some of the most pressing challenges facing the airspace community today, including:

* Safely managing the increasing air traffic in one of the world’s fastest-growing regions.
* Achieving aviation’s ambitious net-zero carbon emissions goal by 2050.
* Seamlessly integrating new airspace users such as eVTOLs, drones, and space launch vehicles into crowded skies.

A Hub for Networking and Collaboration

Attendees will benefit from unparalleled networking opportunities, allowing them to connect with industry peers, share insights, and collaborate on solutions that enhance safety and efficiency in airspace management. The event will feature two dedicated theatres for discussions and presentations, alongside CANSO’s Asia Pacific leadership conference for ANSP CEOs.

Why This Event Matters for the Space Industry

The relevance of **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025** extends beyond traditional aviation; it is crucial for the burgeoning space industry as well. With increasing interest in space launches and satellite operations within urban environments, this event will address how to integrate these new technologies into existing air traffic systems. By fostering dialogue between airspace managers and space industry stakeholders, the conference aims to create a cohesive strategy for safe and efficient airspace utilization.

Be Part of the Future

Don’t miss your chance to be part of this landmark event that aims to shape a safer, more efficient future for airspace management in the Asia Pacific region. Join us at **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025** to explore innovations, network with industry leaders, and contribute to discussions that will define the future of our skies. Secure your spot today!
organizer: CANSO Civil Air Navigation Services Organisation

title: AIAA SciTech Forum 2026
description:
The **AIAA SciTech Forum 2026** will be held from **January 12 to 16, 2026**, at the **Hyatt Regency Orlando** in Florida. Recognized as the world’s largest aerospace research and technology event, it will attract over 6,100 professionals from 48 countries. This forum serves as a premier platform for sharing cutting-edge aerospace science, innovation, and technology.

The event features a comprehensive technical program alongside plenary and Forum 360 sessions. The technical program includes detailed presentations addressing aerospace challenges and solutions. Each session consists of six 20-minute presentations followed by Q&A. Plenary sessions focus on strategic issues shaping aerospace’s future, while Forum 360 offers interactive discussions with industry leaders and experts.

**ABOUT THE ORGANIZER**

**American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)**, a leading professional society dedicated to advancing aerospace science and technology[1](https://aiaa.org/scitech/)[2](https://aiaa.org/scitech/utility/about/information-organizers/)[5](http://www.showseye.com/fairs/AIAA-SciTech.html). The organizing team includes a guiding coalition of aerospace experts from major industry players such as Lockheed Martin Space, NASA, Honeywell, Northrop Grumman, and academic institutions like TU Delft and Carnegie Mellon University[2](https://aiaa.org/scitech/utility/about/information-organizers/). These experts oversee the technical program, ensuring a high-quality, comprehensive agenda covering aerospace research, innovation, and emerging technologies.

Keynote speeches will be delivered by renowned aerospace figures. Panel discussions will explore emerging trends, technologies, and policy impacts. Workshops will provide hands-on learning and foster collaboration among attendees. An international exhibition will showcase the latest aerospace innovations, products, and services. Networking events will enable meaningful connections among academia, industry, and government professionals.

The venue, Hyatt Regency Orlando, is located at 9801 International Drive and offers easy access to Orlando International Airport, about 13 miles away. On-site parking and public transportation options are available. The hotel provides modern conference facilities and comfortable accommodations for attendees.

Important deadlines include manuscript submission by December 2, 2025, with abstract submissions opening earlier. Presenters must register and participate in session preparation to ensure smooth knowledge exchange during the event.

The forum covers aerospace engineering, propulsion, materials, space systems, and emerging fields like artificial intelligence, autonomous systems, and sustainability. Collaborative research and innovation will be strongly encouraged.

AIAA SciTech Forum 2026 is essential for aerospace professionals seeking advanced knowledge and networking. It offers unparalleled opportunities to engage with global experts and accelerate aerospace technology development.
organizer: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)

title: APACE 2026
description:
The **Asia Pacific Aerospace Conference & Exhibition (APACE) 2026** will take place in Sarawak, Malaysia, serving as a premier aerospace event for over 1,000 professionals from more than 50 countries. Hosted by the **Ministry of Education, Innovation and Talent Development (MEITD) Sarawak** and organized by **Borneo Business Connect Sdn Bhd**, APACE aims to establish Sarawak as Borneo’s aerospace hub and a leading player in Asia-Pacific’s aerospace industry. The event combines innovation, sustainability, and regional collaboration to accelerate aerospace growth across the region.

A Strategic Platform for Aerospace Innovation and Sustainability

APACE 2026 spotlights cutting-edge aerospace advancements, including green aviation, AI-driven aerospace solutions, and digital twins, which are transforming the industry worldwide. Moreover, it promotes sustainable technologies and practices, reflecting global commitments to reducing environmental impact. Participants will engage with over 100 exhibitor booths showcasing breakthroughs in satellite technology, sustainable aviation fuels, and advanced manufacturing processes. This diverse exhibition fosters cross-sector innovation, encouraging partnerships that address both commercial and environmental challenges within aerospace.

Extensive Program Featuring Expert Panels and Workshops

Spanning three impactful days, APACE 2026 offers more than 60 sessions, including high-level keynote speeches, technical workshops, and panel discussions led by global aerospace leaders, CEOs, policymakers, and researchers. These sessions focus on the latest trends, such as workforce development, digital transformation, and regulatory frameworks shaping the industry’s future. Importantly, the conference emphasizes talent development by connecting students with industry mentors and practical internship opportunities, ensuring the pipeline of aerospace expertise remains strong.

Networking Opportunities Driving Business and Policy Collaboration

The event creates dynamic environments for interaction among industry executives, investors, government officials, and academics. Dedicated networking zones, investor pitch sessions, and collaboration forums facilitate deal-making, knowledge exchange, and strategic alliances. Business Events Sarawak (BESarawak) supports the event, further reinforcing Sarawak’s ambition to grow its aerospace cluster through international cooperation. Consequently, APACE 2026 acts as a catalyst for boosting aerospace investments and regional economic development.

Why Aerospace Professionals Must Attend APACE 2026

For engineers, entrepreneurs, policymakers, and investors, APACE 2026 offers unparalleled market insights, exposure to emerging technologies, and access to vital business networks. The conference’s location in Sarawak provides unique opportunities to engage with a rapidly expanding aerospace sector within the dynamic Asia-Pacific market. Furthermore, attendees benefit from exploring innovative solutions aligned with global aerospace trends while influencing regional and international policies for sustainable aviation growth.

APACE 2026, Sarawak’s Aerospace Milestone

the Asia Pacific Aerospace Conference & Exhibition 2026 represents a landmark event uniting industry pioneers dedicated to advancing innovation and sustainability in aerospace. Through its comprehensive program and extensive networking opportunities, APACE empowers participants to shape the future aerospace landscape in Sarawak and beyond

title: International Space industry exhibition (ISIEX) 2026
description:
The **International Space Industry Exhibition (ISIEX) 2026** will take place from **January 28 to 30, 2026**, at the world-class **Tokyo Big Sight** in Koto-ku, Tokyo, Japan. Organized by **Nikkan Kogyo Shimbun Ltd.** This exhibition attracts global companies, academic institutions, government agencies, and startups eager to showcase cutting-edge space technologies and foster international cooperation. As a result, ISIEX 2026 becomes the key event for advancing space market development, technology exchange, and commercial partnerships globally.

A Premier Venue for Uniting Space Stakeholders

Tokyo Big Sight, located at **3-11-1 Ariake, Koto-ku, Tokyo 135-0063, Japan**, offers a state-of-the-art environment with excellent transportation links for easy access by global visitors. Moreover, Nikkan Kogyo Shimbun Ltd., a major industrial news company in Japan, leads the organization along with substantial support from space agencies and industrial partners. With approximately **300 exhibitors** and **20,000 visitors** expected, this venue will host a diverse range of space industry sectors, including communications, robotics, satellite development, and space environment conservation.

Comprehensive Exhibits Addressing Industry Innovations

The exhibition will cover critical areas like communication satellites, ground station development, robotics innovations, environmental monitoring, and spacefood production technology. Exhibitors will include heavy industry manufacturers, venture-backed startups, and research organizations aiming to expand market access and commercialize new technologies. Consequently, the event provides unparalleled exposure to emerging trends and investment opportunities worldwide.

Facilitating Networking and High-Level Dialogues

For example, thematic discussions on lunar exploration and spaceport development help spur collaborative initiatives and public-private partnerships. Therefore, attendees can form strategic alliances accelerating space projects’ success and drive regional and international cooperation. This environment fosters direct dialogue essential for tackling technical challenges and regulatory complexities facing the space industry.

Why Professionals Should Attend ISIEX 2026

Industry professionals, entrepreneurs, and officials gain firsthand knowledge about new technologies, policies, and market strategies at ISIEX. Moreover, by attending this event, they can tap into Asia’s growing space economy while accessing global investment and cooperation networks. Furthermore, the timing strategically aligns with accelerating space commercialization and international space diplomacy. Thus, ISIEX 2026 represents a must-attend event for stakeholders committed to shaping the future of space innovation and business on a global scale.

Accelerating Space Innovation at Tokyo Big Sight

title: IEEE Aerospace Conference 2026
description:
The **IEEE Aerospace Conference 2026** will take place from **March 1 to 8, 2026**, at the **Yellowstone Conference Center** in **Big Sky, Montana, USA**. This annual event is a premier gathering for aerospace professionals, including researchers, engineers, military personnel, and industry leaders. It provides a unique forum to explore aerospace systems, technologies, and applications across government and commercial sectors.

Organizers and Sponsorship

The conference is organized by the **IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Society (AESS)**, which focuses on advancing aerospace technology and systems engineering. It is technically co-sponsored by the **American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)** and the **Prognostics and Health Management (PHM) Society**. These collaborations ensure a diverse and high-quality technical program.The IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Society (AESS) is a leading professional organization advancing aerospace and electronic systems technology worldwide. It serves a diverse community of professionals from industry, academia, and government research centers.

Leading experts such as David Woerner (Jet Propulsion Laboratory), Kendra Cook (SAIC), Alex Austin (JPL), and Michael Gross (NASA JPL) will contribute to the conference. Their extensive experience in space missions, autonomous systems, and aerospace project management will enrich the program. This leadership attracts over 1,000 aerospace professionals worldwide.

IEEE Aerospace Conference 2026 Highlights

The conference features plenary sessions, technical presentations, panel discussions, and interactive workshops. Topics include aerospace frontiers, future space and Earth science missions, autonomous systems, space security, and emerging technologies. Attendees will engage in knowledge exchange and explore innovative solutions to aerospace challenges.

Venue and Location

The Yellowstone Conference Center is located in scenic Big Sky, Montana. The venue offers modern facilities and a focused environment for collaboration. Its natural surroundings provide a unique backdrop for in-depth discussions and networking.

Attending the IEEE Aerospace Conference 2026 offers unparalleled opportunities to connect with global experts. Participants can discover the latest research, share ideas, and develop partnerships. The event supports professional growth and advances aerospace innovation.
organizer: IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Society (AESS)

title: Amsterdam Space Symposium

Welcome to the Amsterdam Space Symposium

We are not your run-of-the-mill space gathering. Nope, we’re a convergence of diverse minds who grasp that space holds the key to tackling Earth’s biggest challenges.

Space infrastructure and space services are increasingly important to our society. Imagine a day without navigation, global communication, weather forecasts, or daily observations across the globe. In times when society faces global challenges in areas like security and climate, it is imperative to continue sharing our ideas, developments, and achievements in the fields of space technology, space infrastructure, and space applications.

At this symposium, we champion collaboration between the global space ecosystem and adjacent sectors by linking political and strategic discussions with solutions across the entire supply chain.

Expect the unexpected. Brace yourself for thought-provoking sessions and enlightening discussions that challenge your perspectives. Immerse yourself in a dynamic program filled with knowledge-sharing, inspiration, and collaborative opportunities.

So, buckle up for the Amsterdam Space Symposium, where extraordinary encounters await.

title: Munich Space week 2026
description:
The **Munich Space Week 2026** will take place from **March 23 to 27, 2026**, in **Munich, Germany**. This inaugural event marks the merger of two prominent conferences—the **Munich New Space Summit** and the **Munich Satellite Navigation Summit**—creating a comprehensive platform that unites the New Space sector with satellite navigation communities.

Munich Space Week is part of the Space Golden League, an alliance of four major European space events. The league includes events in Brussels, Paris, Rome, and Munich. Its goal is to strengthen Europe’s space economy through collaboration and innovation.

The event aims to promote cross-sector cooperation to drive innovation and efficiency. It also seeks to enhance Europe’s strategic autonomy in the global space market.

Munich Space Week 2026 Highlights

**Diverse Participation:** The event will subsequently gather industry leaders, academia, government representatives, and innovative startups to engage in discussions on critical topics such as space exploration, satellite navigation, space defense, and sustainable space technologies.

**Rich Program:** Attendees can expect inspiring keynote speeches, dynamic panel discussions, interactive workshops, and an international exhibition showcasing cutting-edge space technologies and solutions.

**Networking Opportunities:** Dedicated sessions will facilitate meaningful connections between established players and emerging startups, fostering collaboration and business development.

**Part of the Space Golden League:** Munich Space Week is a key component of the newly formed **Space Golden League**, an alliance of four major European space events held in Brussels, Paris, Rome, and Munich. This league aims to advance the European space economy by coordinating events to maximize cross-sector collaboration and impact.

Objectives

**Foster Cross-Sector Collaboration:** Encourage cooperation across various space sectors to drive innovation and efficiency.

**Strengthen Europe’s Strategic Autonomy:** Enhance Europe’s competitiveness and independence in the global space arena.

**Showcase Innovation:** Highlight new business models and technological advancements within the European space ecosystem.

Munich Space Week 2026 promises to be a pivotal event for the European and global space communities, serving as a hub for innovation, strategic dialogue, and partnership building in space exploration and satellite navigation.

title: Earth & Space 2026
description:
The Earth & Space 2026 Conference, officially the 20th International Conference on Engineering, Science, Construction, and Operations in Challenging Environments, will hold from April 13 to 16, 2026, at Texas A&M University in College Station, Texas.

Earth & Space 2026 focuses on the engineering, scientific, and operational challenges associated with harsh environments such as the lunar and Martian surfaces, deep space, and extreme terrestrial locations. The conference provides a unique platform to share cutting-edge research, innovative technologies, and practical solutions for sustainable human and robotic presence beyond Earth’s atmosphere. It also addresses critical infrastructure and construction challenges that arise when designing and operating systems in these demanding conditions.

This conference is particularly timely as it coincides with the opening of the Texas A&M University Space Institute in fall 2026, a state-of-the-art research facility located near NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. The Space Institute will feature the world’s largest indoor simulation environments replicating lunar and Martian surfaces, high-bay laboratories, and collaborative spaces designed to accelerate space exploration research and development. This proximity to NASA and the collaborative environment the institute fosters will enhance the conference’s impact by providing attendees with direct access to cutting-edge facilities and research initiatives.

Earth & Space Themes and Symposia

Earth & Space 2026 is structured around several specialized symposia that cover a broad range of topics critical to space and extreme environment engineering:

**Granular Materials in Space Exploration:** Exploring the behavior and utilization of lunar and Martian regolith, soil mechanics, and material handling in low-gravity environments

.**Exploration and Utilization of Extra-Terrestrial Bodies:** Discussing mission planning, surface operations, resource extraction, and habitat construction on the Moon, Mars, and other celestial bodies.

**Advanced Materials and Designs for Aerospace and Terrestrial Structures:** Innovations in materials science and structural engineering tailored for extreme temperature, radiation, and mechanical stress conditions.

**Structures in Challenging Environments:** Focusing on dynamics, controls, smart structures, health monitoring, and sensor technologies to ensure safety and reliability.

**Space Engineering, Construction, and Architecture for Moon, Mars, and Beyond:** Addressing architectural design, construction techniques, and infrastructure development for permanent human settlements in space.

These symposia encourage interdisciplinary collaboration, bringing together civil engineers, aerospace engineers, architects, scientists, and industry leaders to exchange knowledge and develop integrated solutions for future space missions and terrestrial applications.

title: 12th International Conference on High Temperature Capillarity HTC 2026
description:
This is the conference about all aspects of high temperature capillarity and surface-interface phenomena. It is the place, where the world’s top researchers in the field, senior scientists as well as young researchers gather and present their latest results. The HTC conferences look back on a long-lasting tradition since 1994. We are especially proud to have the opportunity and the privilege to organize this important event.

**The 12th conference of this series will take place in 2026 in Forsbach near Cologne.**

There will be oral & poster sessions as well as contributed and invited presentations. There will be Young Presenters Awards for the best posters- and oral presentations.

We expect around 130 of the best scientists of the field, including yourself. A selection of the best papers will be published in a Special Issue of the Journal [High Temperatures – High Pressures.](https://www.oldcitypublishing.com/journals/hthp-home/)

We cordially invite you to join the **12th International Conference on High Temperature Capillarity (HTC 2026)**, and welcome your submission.

Please note:

* Abstract submission and registration will open in summer 2025
* We plan a guided tour to DLR/ ESA on 8 May 2026. More information will follow.

Sincerely yours,  
Jürgen Brillo, host
organizer: DLR Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt

title: IAASS Conference 2026
description:
The 14th IAASS Conference 2026, titled “Together for a Safe Space Frontier,” will be held from May 5 to 7, 2026, in Albuquerque, New Mexico. This event is organized by the International Association for the Advancement of Space Safety (IAASS), a leading authority dedicated to promoting safety, security, and sustainability in outer space. Professionals from industry, government, and academia will gather to discuss critical challenges and solutions.

Focus on Space Safety and Sustainability

The conference program covers a wide range of topics, including space debris mitigation, launch and re-entry safety, human factors, and regulatory frameworks. Attendees will benefit from expert presentations, technical sessions, and panel discussions designed to share the latest research and best practices. Furthermore, the event emphasizes international cooperation to address the growing complexity of space operations. IAASS, founded in 2004 in the Netherlands, promotes international cooperation and scientific progress in space systems safety globally. The IAASS Board governs the association, with up to 30 elected members representing various nationalities and professional backgrounds. Technical Committees include experts from agencies, industry, and academia, focusing on areas like launch safety, space hazards, and human factors. IAASS gained Observer status at the United Nations COPUOS in 2010, enhancing its role in global space safety policy discussions.

IAASS Conference 2026 Opportunities for Collaboration

In addition to formal sessions, the IAASS Conference offers workshops and seminars that encourage active participation and networking. A student paper competition also supports the development of emerging professionals in space safety. These activities foster a collaborative environment where new ideas and partnerships can flourish, advancing the global space safety culture.

Importance for Industry and Policy Makers

Given the increasing number of space missions and actors, ensuring safety and sustainability has become paramount. This conference provides a unique platform for stakeholders to align on standards, regulations, and innovative technologies. Ultimately, the IAASS Conference plays a vital role in securing the long-term viability of space activities for all users.

title: SAHA Expo 2026

title: Global Space and Technology Convention & Exhibition (GSTCE) 2026

title: ISSA 2026
description:

Moreover, ISSA emphasizes Africa’s rich potential for space manufacturing and satellite services, aiming to accelerate industrial capacity while supporting space technology’s role in addressing pressing socio-economic challenges across the continent.

Addressing Critical Themes with Impact

Over the three days, ISSA 2026 will showcase thematic conferences that dive into satellite communication, Earth observation, space policy, and sustainable development. These sessions encourage participants to consider not only advanced technologies but also the regulatory frameworks necessary to foster innovation responsibly. By seamlessly blending policy, technology, and business perspectives, the summit ensures an integrated approach necessary for Africa’s growing prominence in the global space sector.

A Gateway to New Markets and Opportunities

For businesses involved in procurement, fabrication, sales, and technical production, ISSA presents unmatched opportunities to showcase products, forge reseller partnerships, and navigate regional market entry challenges. The exhibition space features some of the most innovative space solutions tailored to African contexts, while networking sessions ensure that decision-makers connect directly with potential clients or collaborators. Hence, ISSA represents a practical and strategic venue for maximizing business growth and innovation impact.

ISSA 2026 stands out as a focal point where vision meets execution in Africa’s space industry. Professionals seeking to engage deeply with the continent’s space supply chains, manufacturing advancements, or regulatory evolution must leverage this event’s comprehensive platform. The summit’s dynamic agenda and international reach will undoubtedly catalyze new partnerships and ideas that shape Africa’s future in space exploration and exploitation. Consequently, marking your calendar for ISSA 2026 in Pretoria is essential for anyone serious about pioneering space technologies and markets across Africa.

title: 44th International Space Development Conference (ISDC) 2026
description:
The **International Space Development Conference (ISDC) 2026** will be held from **June 4 to 7, 2026**, in **McLean, Virginia, USA**. This annual event, organized by the **National Space Society (NSS)**, brings together a diverse community of space professionals, enthusiasts, academics, entrepreneurs, and policymakers. It serves as a premier forum to discuss the latest advancements in space exploration, technology, policy, and development.

ISDC 2026 Focus and Program

ISDC 2026 covers a broad range of topics, including Moon and Mars exploration, deep space missions, space settlement, innovative technologies, space law, and commercial space activities. The program features keynote speeches, panel discussions, technical presentations, workshops, and networking events. Attendees engage with leaders from government agencies, private industry, academia, and grassroots organizations, fostering collaboration across sectors.

Attendees and Networking Opportunities

Typically, ISDC attracts between 800 and 1,000 participants annually, including 300 to 400 international delegates. This diverse attendance promotes global dialogue on space development challenges and opportunities. The conference also emphasizes inspiring the next generation of space professionals through student competitions, educational programs, and outreach activities.

Organizers and Legacy

The National Space Society, a nonprofit dedicated to advancing spacefaring civilization, organizes ISDC. NSS has over 10,000 members worldwide and actively promotes STEM education and public engagement in space. Since its inception in 1982, ISDC has grown into a flagship event, recognized internationally for its role in shaping space policy and innovation.

Venue and Location

The 2026 conference will take place in McLean, Virginia, a strategic location near Washington, D.C., facilitating participation by government officials and industry leaders. This proximity enhances opportunities for policy discussions and collaboration with federal space agencies.

Why Attend ISDC 2026?

Attending ISDC 2026 offers professionals a unique chance to stay current on space industry trends, influence policy, and build valuable networks. The event’s multidisciplinary approach supports innovation and helps accelerate humanity’s expansion into space.

title: ILA Berlin 2026
description:
ILA Berlin leads in innovation, new technology, and sustainability, bringing the world’s aerospace industry to the center of Europe every two years – next time from June 10 to 16, 2026.

ILA Berlin: Pioneering Aerospace since 1909

With its sectors Aviation, Space, Defence & Support, Advanced Air Mobility, and Supplier, ILA Berlin covers the entire value chain of the aerospace industry. Here, we vividly demonstrate how the transformation of civil aviation towards climate neutrality can succeed. The unique Space Pavilion showcases the diverse benefits of space exploration for life on Earth – from climate protection and digitalization to security and mobility. The military section emphasizes the importance of the armed forces in defending our democratic values and European sovereignty. In the Advanced Air Mobility exhibition area, the full spectrum of unmanned aerial systems and electric vertical take-off and landing vehicles (eVTOLs) is presented. The International Supplier Center connects the extensive supply chain with buyers from OEMs and 1st-tier suppliers. Key topics include climate-neutral flying, digitalization, and supply chain stability.

In 2024, the European Commission once again served as a strategic partner of ILA Berlin. This partnership strengthens Europe’s technological leadership and paves the way for a sustainable future in aerospace under the motto “Airborne in Europe.”

Results of ILA 2024

In 2024, ILA Berlin welcomed approximately 95,000 visitors and 600 exhibitors from 31 countries. Over 850 journalists reported on-site. On the new five ILA STAGES, 350 speakers participated in expert talks, panel discussions, debates, and science slams discussing future trends in aerospace.

To prepare for a career start or advancement in the fascinating world of aerospace, the TALENT HUB at ILA 2024 offered numerous opportunities for networking and exchange to both young talents and experienced professionals. Friday was dedicated to TALENT DAY, where 1,500 participants explored career opportunities with our exhibitors. Forty exhibitors registered as Talent Hub partners, benefiting from increased visibility both on-site and digitally, as well as the opportunity to promote their job openings through us. A total of 210 job offers were uploaded to our digital platform, ILA Digital.

ILA is jointly organized by BDLI (German Aerospace Industries Association) and Messe Berlin. The next ILA will take place from June 10 to 14, 2026.

title: Aeromart Hyderabad
description:
What is Aeromart Hyderabad?

Aeromart Hyderabad, India is a supply chain & MRO forum reserved for vetted suppliers and OEMs promoting capabilities, services, and applications for both commercial and defence aviation.

Aeromart Hyderabad stands as unique venue in India, where international and Indian OEMs, Top tier suppliers and contract manufacturers will engage in pre-arranged business meetings.

The event is centered around BCI Aerospace signature matchmaking program, renowned for its success at events such as Aeromart Toulouse, Aeromart Montreal, A&DSS Seattle and Aerospace & Defense Meetings Torino.

Do not wait to secure your participation for the second edition! June 29, 30-July 1st, 2026, Hyderabad Telangana, India

title: Assises du NewSpace I 2026
description:
The **Assises du NewSpace I 2026** is a major French and European space industry conference scheduled for **July 8–9, 2026**, in **Paris, France**. It is organized by a collective of key players in the French space ecosystem, including Alliance NewSpace France, CNES, ESA, Eutelsat, GIFAS, ISAE-SUPAERO, and several other leading aerospace and space innovation organizations.

Event Overview

The Assises du NewSpace I 2026 is an influential annual summit focusing on the *NewSpace* economy, bringing together entrepreneurs, industry leaders, researchers, government representatives, service providers involved in the rapidly evolving commercial space sector. Since its inception in 2022, it has become a pivotal platform for discussing space innovation, market trends, policy, and technological breakthroughs shaping the future of space activities in France and Europe.

Location and Venue

The 2026 edition will hold in Paris, at the Centre des Congrès de la Villette .This location situates the event at the heart of Europe’s largest scientific and innovation hub, facilitating high-level exchanges and networking.

Assises du NewSpace I 2026 Themes and Focus Areas

Exploration of the *NewSpace* ecosystem, including startups, industrial companies, and service firms.

Discussions on the future of the space economy, including market dynamics, investment opportunities, and commercialization strategies.

Policy and regulatory frameworks supporting space innovation and sustainable development.

Technological advancements in satellite manufacturing, launch services, space applications, and digital space technologies.

Strategic partnerships between public institutions, private sector, and academia to accelerate space sector growth.

Emphasis on the European and French space ambitions and how to position the region as a global leader in space innovation.

Assises du NewSpace I 2026 serves as a critical forum to unite the French and European space community, promoting innovation, investment, and strategic dialogue. It supports France’s ambition to strengthen its position in the global space economy and helps align stakeholders around common goals for sustainable and competitive space development.
organizer: Alliance NewSpace France, CNES (the French space agency), ESA, GIFAS, ISAE-SUPAERO

title: Farnborough International Airshow FIA 2026
description:
Every two years, the aerospace, aviation and defence industries are invited to Farnborough International Exhibition & Conference Centre for the world’s best airshow. Providing unparalleled opportunities to build new connections, engage with thought leaders and pioneer change.

FIA 2026

Taking place 20-24 July, Farnborough International Airshow FIA 2026 offers a unique opportunity for leading innovators in aerospace and defence industries to showcase their advancements. Harness the convening power of this premier event to engage with industry peers on a global stage, create partnerships and propel your business forward in a rapidly evolving landscape.

The Show

Explore everything the Farnborough International Airshow has to offer, from its leading show features to unparalleled networking opportunities, all centred around the key themes of the industry today.

title: 46th Scientific Assembly COSPAR 2026
description:
The 46th COSPAR Scientific Assembly will be held in Florence, Italy, 1 – 9 August 2026. The **Call for Abstracts/Announcement** will be posted here in due course and via a link in the August 2025 issue of *Space Research Today*, COSPAR’s information bulletin.  Much Assembly information, especially concerning the scientific program, will be included in this issue. No second announcement will be published although all information, as well as the updated program, will be posted as it becomes available.  The scientific program for the 46th Scientific Assembly will be accessible from mid-August 2025 by clicking the “**[46th COSPAR Scientific Assembly](https://www.cospar-assembly.org/assembly.php)**” link. Registration, accommodation, and other logistical information may be found as it becomes available on the [**website**](https://www.cospar2026.org/) of the COSPAR 2026 Local Organizing Committee.

The complete scientific program for the 45th Scientific Assembly, held in Busan, South Korea, 13-21 July 2024, is accessible by clicking the “[**45th COSPAR Scientific Assembly**](https://www.cospar-assembly.org/admin/congress.php?congress=11)” link. Registration, accommodation, and other logistical information can be found on the [**website**](https://www.cospar2024.org/) of the COSPAR 2024 Local Organizing Committee.

title: ION GNSS+ 2026
description:
The **ION GNSS+ 2026** conference will take place from **September 14 to 18, 2026**, in Orlando, Florida, attracting global GNSS experts. This event offers an unparalleled platform for engineers, researchers, and industry leaders to exchange cutting-edge ideas and discuss future satellite navigation technologies. Given the rapid pace of innovation, attending this conference ensures professionals stay ahead in the evolving GNSS landscape.

Extensive Technical Program and Keynotes

The conference features over 300 technical presentations covering GPS modernization, Galileo system updates, and multisensory navigation integration. Moreover, keynote speeches from top GNSS authorities provide strategic insights into space-based positioning and timing technologies. Additionally, panel discussions address critical challenges such as signal interference, anti-spoofing, and regulatory policies. These sessions enable attendees to deepen their understanding of current trends and emerging solutions.

ION GNSS+ 2026 Training and Tutorials

On September 16 and 17, the conference offers specialized short courses and tutorials designed to enhance participants’ expertise. Topics include GNSS receiver architecture, advanced signal processing, and innovative anti-jamming techniques. These practical sessions allow professionals to acquire valuable skills applicable to real-world navigation and timing challenges. Consequently, attendees leave better equipped to implement cutting-edge GNSS technologies.

Exhibits and Networking Opportunities

The exhibit hall opens on September 16 and 17, showcasing the latest GNSS products and services from industry leaders and startups alike. This environment encourages collaboration and business development through meaningful networking. Furthermore, the event fosters connections among academia, government agencies, and commercial enterprises, promoting cross-sector partnerships. As a result, participants gain access to new opportunities and insights.

Attending ION GNSS+ 2026 provides professionals with critical knowledge, hands-on training, and networking essential for success in satellite navigation. The event’s comprehensive program and collaborative atmosphere make it indispensable for anyone involved in positioning, navigation, and timing technologies. Mark your calendar and prepare to engage with the forefront of GNSS innovation in Orlando next September.

title: International Astronautical Congress IAC 2026
description:
The IAC is the one place and time of the year where all global space actors come together. The event attracts more than 6,000 participants each year. Covering all space sectors and topics, it offers everyone the latest space information and developments in academia and industry, networking opportunities, contacts and potential partnerships.

What is the IAC?

The IAC is the one place and time of the year where all global space actors come together. The event attracts more than 6,000 participants each year. Covering all space sectors and topics, it offers everyone the latest space information and developments in academia and industry, networking opportunities, contacts and potential partnerships.

Each year, the IAC changes country, theme and local organizer, enabling all to learn more about, and be a part of the world space scene.

IAC 2026 Antalya

Our passion to explore space comes from ages. Space is not new to us however our enthusiasm never ages. We have been working hard for a very long time to be among the countries that contribute to the exploration of space…

Now, we are starting the countdown for Turkey’s space travel and taking the first step on the 100th anniversary of the Republic. To multiply the great steps for humanity, we will reach the Moon in 2026.

Every individual in the country is involved in the enthusiasm of technology. We are all united and waiting for the countdown. Now with all this spirit and potential Turkiye is hosting IAC 2026 in Antalya. The tourism capital of Turkey, where perfect beaches, sea and sun meet. With the opportunity to travel with Turkish Airlines, the airline that flies to the most countries in the World Its historical structure blending the past and the present, now rotates to future…

At the Antalya NEST congress center, there is enough space for everyone.

An Outstanding Social Tour at Side Ancient City

As an optional recreational event, meticulously tailored for an exclusive group in mind, a social tour will be hosted in the ancient city of Side. The event will consist of a visit to the Side Ancient City, a bespoke performance at the Ancient Theatre, and an unforgettable experience augmented by a special reception at the meticulously restored Temples Area.

title: 6th Space Passive Component Days SPCD 2026
description:
**6th SPACE PASSIVE COMPONENT DAYS – SPCD 2026**

13-16 October 2026 | ESA/ESTEC, Noordwijk, The Netherlands

Passive Components represent more than 80% of the EEE parts used in spacecraft. Therefore, they represent a major concern for space applications. In recent years, the development of Passive Components has been driven by reliability, performances, new functionalities, mass and volume saving and cost reduction.

Space Passive Component Days SPCD 2026 international Symposium

The SPCD international Symposium is the premier technical conference dedicated to Passive components for space applications. It is an exceptional venue to learn more about the latest advances in this field and meet recognized experts from industry, academia and agencies.

Aim of the SPCD symposium is to promote the discussion of recent developments and trends and to encourage the exchange of technical expertise and information covering a broad range of EEE passive components for space applications:

* Capacitors
* Power dividers & Couplers
* Circulators & Isolators
* Relays & Switches
* Connectors & Cable assemblies
* Resistors
* Crystals & Resonators
* RF Switches & Phase shifters
* Fuses
* SAW Devices
* Heaters
* Supercapacitors
* Inductors & Transformers
* Thermal Sensors & Thermistors
* Loads & Attenuators
* Thermoelectric Coolers
* Oscillators
* Thermostats
* Piezo element
* Wires & Cables

SPCD 2026 topics

The symposium consists of both invited and submitted papers covering the following topics :

* Application, Trends and Needs
* Commercial Off-The-Shelf  (COTS)
* Evaluation & Qualification
* Lessons Learned and In-flight Experiences
* Materials and Processes
* New Developments
* Normative System & Standards
* Procurement, Distribution
* Technology Roadmaps
* Test, Reliability and Evaluation for space

How Can You Participate in SPCD?

You can participate in SPCD conference in one or more of the following ways:

#### As a Presenter:

Present a technical paper or a poster by submitting an abstract and choosing your presentation preference.

#### As a Commercial Presenter:

Give a commercial presentation by submitting a Technical Introduction of Components (TICs).

#### As a Roadmap Presenter:

Present your company’s roadmap to purchasing and supply managers only.

#### As an Exhibitor:

Exhibit by booking a booth and promoting your services and components.

#### As a Sponsor:

Provide your company with greater visibility by choosing one of the sponsorship packages.

#### As a Participant:

Register to the conference and take advantage from the conference presentations, exhibition, networking breaks, welcome drink and the Gala dinner.

title: 58th Division For Planetary Sciences Annual Meeting
description:
In 1968, a group of members of the American Astronomical Society (AAS) developed a sub-organization within the AAS devoted to solar system research. The first organizing committee members were: E. Anders, L. Branscomb, J. W. Chamberlain, R. Goody, J. S. Hall, A. Kliore, M. B. McElroy, T. Owen, G. H. Pettengill, C. Sagan, and H. J. Smith.

Today, the Division for Planetary Science is the largest special interest Division of the AAS. Members of the DPS study the bodies of our own solar system from planets and moons to comets and asteroids and all other solar system objects and processes. With the discovery that planets exist around other stars, the DPS expanded its scope to include the study of extrasolar planetary systems as well.

title: Big Science Business Forum 2026
description:
**Big Science Business Forum 2026: Bridging Science and Industry**

The **Big Science Business Forum 2026 (BSBF2026)** will take place in Maastricht, Netherlands, offering a premier platform for industry and research organizations across Europe. Scheduled for 2026, this fourth edition follows successful events in Trieste, Copenhagen, and Granada, which drew over 1,000 delegates from 500 organizations across 30 countries.

### **Why Attend BSBF2026?**

BSBF2026 is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to connect with Europe’s leading Big Science Organizations (BSOs), including CERN, ESA, ESO, and ITER. The event will highlight procurement and collaboration opportunities in the Big Science market, valued at billions of euros annually.

* **Meet Big Science Leaders:** Engage with procurement and technical representatives from major BSOs to align your expertise with their needs.
* **Explore Business Opportunities:** Discover upcoming calls and competitions managed by BSOs under specialized rules and procedures.
* **Network with Experts:** Join over 1,200 participants, including industry leaders, research institutions, and decision-makers, to foster partnerships and share ideas.

### **Key Highlights of BSBF2026**

* **Focus on High Technology & Innovation:** Explore how science and industry collaborate to push technological boundaries.
* **Exhibition Opportunities:** Showcase your business or organization to a diverse audience of European and international stakeholders.
* **Dynamic Sessions:** Gain insights into the latest trends and future prospects in the Big Science market.

### **Event Details**

* **Location:** Maastricht, Netherlands
* **Date:** 2026 (Exact dates to be announced)
* **Audience:** Businesses, researchers, policymakers, and innovators in high technology and research infrastructure.

title: Indo Aerospace Expo & Forum 2026
description:

Organized by **PT Napindo Media Ashatama**, this event represents one of Southeast Asia’s most significant aerospace gatherings, connecting industry leaders, innovators, policymakers, and investors from around the world. Strategic Venue Supporting Global Engagement

Moreover, its excellent transportation connectivity within Jakarta and internationally ensures smooth logistics for both exhibitors and attendees. Additionally, the exhibition highlights space-related technologies, aviation security, ground support equipment, and pilot training solutions, reflecting Indonesia’s expanding aerospace ecosystem. This broad yet focused approach allows startups, research institutions, and multinational corporations to showcase innovations, fostering knowledge exchange and technical collaboration. Hence, visitors gain comprehensive insights into evolving aerospace trends.

Interactive Forums and Networking Opportunities

Participants will benefit from expert-led forums, panel discussions, and seminars addressing regulatory challenges, investment strategies, and emerging technologies influencing the Asia-Pacific aerospace market. Furthermore, dedicated B2B matchmaking and networking sessions promote direct dialogue between investors, engineers, policymakers, and business developers. These opportunities accelerate business deals and foster cross-border collaborations crucial for industry growth. Consequently, Indo Aerospace Expo & Forum functions as a critical catalyst for regional aerospace development.

Why Professionals Should Prioritize Attendance

Industry practitioners, executives, investors, and government officials will acquire valuable intelligence on technological breakthroughs and market dynamics specific to Southeast Asia. Moreover, the event’s timing fits Indonesia’s growing aerospace ambitions and infrastructure projects, allowing attendees to influence policymaking and commercial ventures effectively. Attending Indo Aerospace Expo & Forum 2026 creates significant advantages to strengthen networks, secure partnerships, and stay ahead in a competitive aerospace landscape.

Indo Aerospace Expo & Forum 2026 Elevating Southeast Asia’s Aerospace Future

The Indo Aerospace Expo & Forum 2026 offers an exceptional venue for advancing aerospace technology, policy dialogue, and business collaboration in Southeast Asia. By participating, professionals can capitalize on regional growth, contribute to innovation, and shape the aerospace industry’s future.
